texts.en: Rakhila is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Rakhila is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Agdam who now lives in the Absheron region with her loving family. Rakhila has owned a grocery shop for seven years. Now she needs 2300 AZN to expand her shop so it will hold more goods and she can expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Ofelia Ramona

texts.es: Ofelia Ramona se dedica a venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años, que tiene este negocio. Por iniciativa propia fue que inicio este medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento pues ha sido muy productivo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, ropa, cosméticos,tratamientos, sabanas y toallas entre otros productos y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Ella es una persona muy dinámica que siempre está la pendiente de lo que sus clientes le piden y así poder complacerlos y satisfacer la demanda.
texts.en:
Ofelia Ramona has been selling general merchandise for more than 10 years. She started this business through her own initiative in order to earn a living. This is not the first time she has requested a loan since the funding has allowed her to be very productive.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics, treatments, bedding, towels, and other products. Ofelia is dedicated to her business. She is a dynamic person who is always responsive to the requests of her customers. By pleasing them, she is able to satisfy demand.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, cosmetics, treatments, bedding, towels, and other products.

loans.name: Tres Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado tres fronteras se forma con las vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Varias señoras se formaron en un grupo al escuchar acerca del programa de comités de mujeres emprendedoras.Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que con su trabajo ayudan a la manutención de sus hogares y la de sus hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio salen día a día para poder generar los ingresos que servirán para dar una vida decorosa y digna a sus familias.
La Sra Lilian tiene una despena con una gran variedad de productos. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y poder cubrir un poco las deudas que tiene, ademas de esto le ha servido para generar un mayor ingreso para la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para el abastecimiento del stock de mercaderías, como ser carnes, bebidas, hortalizas, ya que sabe que si es que tiene mayor cantidad de variedad podrá atraer a mas clientes.Ella se encuentra muy esperanzada y que el credito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee called “Tres Fronteras” (Three Borders) is composed of neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo.  Several women joined together as a group to hear about the Enterprising Women Program.

All of the women are heads of household who help support their homes and children with their work.  With much effort and sacrifice they go out daily to generate income that they can use to provide dignified and decorous lives for their families.  They have stores that they’ve operated for some time now and have a well defined customer base and wish to expand their scope of operation.  They know that the only way to accomplish this is by stocking their respective businesses and by having a wider variety of products.

Sra. Lilian has a store with a wide variety of products. Thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead and cover a few of the debts she has, as well as generate a larger income for her home. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store, such as meats, beverages, and produce, since she knows that having a wider variety can attract more clients. She is very hopeful of getting the loan because she sees this as a great opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cold cuts, beverages, and more for her store

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda es socia del banco comunal La Positiva del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lleva ocho años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su esposo es técnico dental y por eso decidió trabajar, para estar también en actividad y sentirse útil.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará más productos de belleza como: 2 colonias, 1lápiz labial, 1 crema para el pelo, 1 delineador, 2 enjuagues, 1 esmalte de uñas, 2 perfumes para hombre, 1 fragancia de mujer.
Todos estos productos son los más solicitados por sus amistades y clientes.

Las ganas de trabajar se las dan sus hijos, porque ponen todo de su parte para salir adelante, tanto en sus estudios como en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a member of “La Positiva” (The Positive) Communal Bank of Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children.

Esmeralda has sold beauty products from a catalog for the last 8 years with loans from the Manuela Ramos organization. Her husband is a dental technician and she decided to work so that she too could be active and feel useful.

With this new loan of 1,000 new sols Esmeralda will buy more beauty products, including 2 colognes, 1 lip pencil, 1 skin cream, 1 eye liner, 2 moisturizers, 1 nail polish, 2 men's colognes, and 1 lady's fragrance. These are the products most often solicited by her friends and customers.

The motivation to work comes from her children. Esmeralda puts all her efforts into getting ahead, in her studies as well as in her work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mr. Thon has been working in the farming business for many years. Beside this, he has worked as the assistant chief villager in the Siem Reap Province and gets a fixed salary for his job every month. His wife also assists him in the farm field planting rice crops in both the rainy season and the dry season. Mr. Thon would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to support him in his farming occupation. He will use the loan to pay for plowing costs and to purchase fertilizers and peanut seeds to plant in the rainy season. Mr. Thon is the father of two children, both of whom are attending school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to purchase fertilizers and peanut seeds

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 52, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment. 

Rosalinda has been in this business for 18 years. Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
This is Marisa, age 31, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Nepomuceno, a driver. Together with her husband and children, she manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Marisa operates a variety store, where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood in small quantities. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Marisa makes a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php19,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marisa hopes to bring her whole family closer to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, aged 32 years, is married and has two children. He has been in farming for the past four years. He knew of KADET through other clients registered in his area. This will be his second loan with KADET. He is borrowing KES.30,000. He intends to use it to pay laborers to prepare the land. He will also purchase maize seeds and fertilizer.

With the anticipated profit he plans to expand his farm and further educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for laborers to prepare the land and to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Astou Mbene

texts.fr: soutien de famille, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vend des poissons seches, de l'huile de palme et d'autres produits de ce genre. Marchant ambulante, elle s'active depuis plus de trois ans dans ce domaine. Puis qu'etand soutien de famille, ce prêt lui permettrait d'augmenter son fond de roulement et de participer activement aux dépenses quotidien de la famille. Vivant dans une ville qui est au Sénégal, cette marchande veut tout faire pour améliorer la conditions de vie de ses enfants afin de leur offrir une bonne éduquation et un bon cadre de vie.
texts.en: A married woman and mother of three children living in Senegal, Astou sells dried fish, palm oil and other general food products of this type. She has been a traveling salesperson for the past three years. This loan will allow her to increase the working capital of her business, thus enabling her to support her family by taking care of their daily expenses. She is very keen on improving the living conditions of her children and would like to offer them a strong education and a good life.

loans.use: increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. Her major challenge is seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of accessing bigger loans and expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to install tap water for a water distribution business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To install tap water for a water distribution business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a  34-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling coconut wine  in the Philippines for 3 years. Marilyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut wine to sell, and in  the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Ecelina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe  de 3 filhos e todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos. 

Viveu sempre em Boane provincia de Maputo, é ferramenteira na Macaté  ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 13.000.00mt por mês juntando com o rendimento do seu marido, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a sua casa (ferro, areia, pedra, chapas, cimento e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do material na sua casa. 
Pretende concluir a sua obra para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ecelina was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. She went to school through the tenth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone but her children.

She's always lived in Boane, in the province of Maputo. She's been making tools in Macaté for more than two years and she and earns about 13,000 meticals a month. Together with her husband's earnings, they are able to cover their household expenses and save some in their bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (iron, sand, stone, sheet metal, cement, etc.) to continue work on her house.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish her house so she can provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron, sand, stone, sheet metal, cement, etc.) for her house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa. Juana sigue ejerciendo su carrera profesional pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. 

Juana con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar mas productos D. belleza. 


Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Juana continues participating in Asociación Arariwa’s micro loan unit’s “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank.  She is still practicing her profession but during her free time she sells beauty products.  Juana did very well with her previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits so she wants another loan because it’s very helpful for her business.  She needs the loan to buy more beauty products.  Juana is grateful for the opportunity provided her through this means and commits to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, se dedica a destazar ganado y cerdos, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio ya que lo realiza desD. hace varios años, el oficio lo aprendió D. su madre quien años anteriores se dedica a lo mismo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ganado y cerdo, esta compra le permitirá continuar en el negocio y mejorar su nivel económico para con ello mejorar su nivel D. vida.
La aspiración D. Sandra es seguir en el mercado del destazo y posteriormente agrandar su número D. clientes para generar mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her husband and three children. She butchers cattle and pigs for her living, having worked in this industry for several years. She learned her traD. from her mother, who was in the same business many years before. 

Sandra is seeking a loan to buy cattle and pigs. The purchase will enable her to keep her business going, increase her capital, and thus increase her standard of living. Her goal is to continue in butchery and gradually increase her custoer base to generate greater financial returns.

loans.use: To buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is a 55-year-old mother of five children, four of whom are dependents while the fifth child works in Thailand. Two children are still in school. To make a living and feed her family in a rural area of Moung Russey District, Kea has been farming for more than 12 years on her rice field. 

Kea has been with VisionFund since 2010. And now Kea and two members in her group are requesting a loan from VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income to build some savings for her children and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Sisina Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisina Group in Western Kenya! Frida is the facilitator of the Sisina group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Frida  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Frida had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Frida was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Frida and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Frida will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Sisina group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Frida and her group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда использовала предыдущий кредит КИВА для того, чтобы приобрести полиэтиленовую пленку и семена для своих теплиц. 
В этот раз она снова обращается в КИВА, так как ей нужны дополнительные средства на содержание теплиц и выращивания овощей в этом сезоне, а именно: 10 000 гривен на семена, 5 000 гривен на капельное орошение и еще 
5 000 гривен на закупку пленки.
В этом году дочь поступила учиться в ВУЗ в Запорожье, ушло много средств на поступление и на проживание.
texts.en:
Nadezhda used her previous Kiva loan to buy polyethylene sheeting and seeds for her greenhouses.  She is turning to Kiva once again because she need an additional 10,000 UAH for seeds, 5,000 UAH for drip irrigation, and 5,000 UAH to buy sheeting so she can maintain her greenhouses and raise the season's vegetables.

This year her daughter started college in Zaporizhzhya, and the application and housing expenses have been extremely costly.

loans.use: to expand her greenhouses and buy seeds for the next growing season.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He has engaged in farming for eight straight years and currently produces milk and eggs for the local market. He is aged 37 and married with six children; three are already going to school.

Boaz has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds for his business. Boaz says will be able to make better returns with the loan since he has acquired more skills in managing poultry because he has been in it for eight years. He is optimistic to get enough income to improve his family's living standards and grow the business to the ranks of the leading suppliers in the area.

He does, however, note that poultry diseases are challenging to deal with in the business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Rebecca has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rebecca  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Irene Esperanza

texts.en:
My name is Irene. I am 25 years old and live with my partner in my parents house.

I started working with my grandmother 10 years ago, we used to sell candies and stationary outside an elementary school. 3 years ago, I started my own business selling roasted chicken in a rented local at the Solidaridad Market.

My biggest accomplishment is sending my daughter to school and having some financial stability. 

I am calling the project Rostisería Poi-Pio and believe in providing my clients with great flavor at cheap prices. I will use the loan to buy a larger oven, that way I will be able to attend more clients and grow my business.






I

loans.use: buy a larger oven for her roasting chicken business.

loans.name: Nelda Isabel

texts.es: Neida de 69 años es una mujer con una excelente vitalidad y disposición para los negocios, ella aprendió de su familia el oficio de la panadería y hace 10 años emprendió su propio negocio desde casa, aunque su experiencia es de 30 años en esta labor, ella ofrece exclusivamente productos de repostería: pudines, postres, panes de bono, pastelería francesa y galletería. Se encuentra separada de su cónyuge y asumió el rol de madre soltera de tres hijos a quienes entregó todo su amor y dedicación para que hoy en día sean unos hombres ejemplares. Esta dama labora cuatro días a la semana durante seis horas continuas en la elaboración de sus productos y en la actualidad desea renovar su indumentaria, así que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo y comprar un horno e insumos de repostería. Esta inversión mejorará sus condiciones laborales y garantizará un mejor producto. A futuro Neida proyecta tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su capital de trabajo gracias a esta inversión.

loans.use: comprar un horno e insumos de repostería.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Vero is a young graduate who has completed her vocational education. She recently joined Kraban Support Foundation TEACH lending program. she has drawn her business and marketing plan. she hopes to recruit and train two young girls in her community as apprentice learners in a shop. These learners will assist her in providing beauty and hair care therapy to the many clients in the community. Vero hope to provide hair care services to about 200 women a month in her community. Vero needs a KIVA loan amount of $1125 to purchase the equipment needed to do her job.

loans.use: To purchase 2 hair-dryers and 1 hand-dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose Wangui Mwangi intends to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Atsoupe

texts.en:
Mrs. H. is 30 years old, born in Mission-Tove (a rural suburb of Lomé) and the mother of four children. In order to purchase the cassava, Mrs. H. currently receives loans from wealthy women who drive out from the city to buy her “gari.” The interest on these loans, however, is extremely high and she must repay them every 2-3 weeks.

Mrs. H. makes “gari” (a food derived from the cassava root that is often eaten with beans). Mrs. H. owns some fields of cassava and is asking for a loan of $600 to increase the size of her own land. She knows that she will be able to sell the produce because there is high demand from the women who come to their Saturday market to purchase the “gari.”

Mrs. H. currently lives with her husband and children and is hoping to be able to more easily pay the children’s school fees and to be able to purchase medicine when they become ill. Mrs. H. and her group of 7 women from her village all work very hard producing the “gari” and they take turns going to each other’s homes to help each other with the labor.

loans.use: Mrs. Havon would like to buy more land to grow cassava so she can make & sell "gari" (a food derived from the cassava root that is often eaten with beans).

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia is originally from Victoria, Tamaulipas. She is married and has five children. Her husband works in another city and he isn't always able to send that much money. One of her children has special needs and requires special treatments whose costs cannot be covered by her husband's salary alone. For this reason, Elodia decided to start selling used clothing five years ago. Over time, she has added more merchandise and thus expanded her business.

At present, Elodia needs a loan of $200 in order to continue expanding her business. With that amount of money, she could acquire a metal structure that would allow her to better organize and display her merchandise. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Today you can choose to help those who need the aid most. If you decide to help Elodia, she and her family will be very grateful for your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Elodia es originaria de la localidad de Victoria, Tamaulipas, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad y el dinero que puede enviarles es muy poco, uno de sus hijos es de capacidades diferentes y requiere de consultas y tratamientos especiales cuyo costo no podría ser cubierto sólo con el salario de su esposo, es por esto que Elodia decidió comenzar a vender ropa usada hace cinco años, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo más mercancía y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Elodia necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares para continuar creciendo con su negocio, con esto podrá adquirir una estructura metálica y acomodará de una mejor manera su mercancía para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Elodia y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar K. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 38, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ilgar is a farmer. He started his business in 1990, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The business is very interesting but from time to time requires money input. Ilgar needs capital to buy additional animals to develop his business, increase turnover and profit. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 400 loan, which is enough to buy two calves. He hopes eventually to further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves to raise

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
SOFIA, age 28, single-handedly supports her 7-year-old son and 8-year-old niece through her business, the “T. Shop.” Her shop sells fresh vegetables, fish, fruit, sugar, flour, and other general items. Having started her business in January of this year, she collects about $2.50 in profit each day. Her first loan, which was paid back successfully, helped to initially open the shop. Since then, she has taken out another loan, which was used to help her get back on her feet after her shop was robbed in April. As a result of the robbery, she had to repurchase a scale and restock her inventory. She now has had to also invest in hiring a community watchman to guard her shop at night. The loan she is now requesting will allow her to increase her inventory.

Sofia belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Iim

texts.en: Iim is 35 years old and has a 14-year-old child. She sells clothes on credit and usually earns US$ 5 per day. Her husband, A., is a laborer who earns US$ 1.50 per day. Iim is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more clothes and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Ishmatov

texts.en: Ishmatov J. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan.  He is married and has 3 children. Ishmatov J. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. The business stability and income increase helped him to return, in time, a previous loan. Mr. Ishmatov J. is experienced in business and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock because he  has worked with bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father on the farm as the stock keeper and further in  livestock raising and selling and  milk production. It was the family business. He dreams of having a large flock and to open a business in the meat products making.  In time he dreams of buying a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and milk  goods production (to supply to the bazaars: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc). Now Mr. Ishmatov J. requests a loan of $300 for  business development and a horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for the business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise and to make improvements to his store.

loans.name: Barry

texts.en:
Barry is 28 years old and is an extremely hard working man who is looking for a loan to allow him to increase and improve the inventory of his store to enable him to provide a better life for his wife and four children. He has been running his store for 10 years, since the birth of his first child. His wife and their eldest child work with Barry in the store. All four of his children go to school.

Barry runs two other businesses as well as his general store. He owns four Friesian cows, selling their milk to retailers. He also owns a motorcycle, which he rents to a local man to use as a taxi service.

Barry hopes to be able to afford to buy a new cow to aid his milk production and eventually buy another motorcycle to add to his taxi business.

loans.use: Barry intends to use the loan to purchase additional sugar, salt, cooking oil for his general store.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Perseverance and diligent work helps Edilberto to excel and be one of the best livestock farmers in his area. Every day, he is focused on the development and feeding of his beloved cattle. In the mornings, with much delicacy, he milks the cows. His wife in is charge of distributing the milk to his customers who make cheeses and pastries in their community. He also offers meat and sometimes sells in the livestock markets in his city. He has a great desire to increase the number of animals in his stable and improve the conditions of his livestock supply in order to obtain exceptional development.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La perseverancia y trabajo diligente ayudan a Edilberto a sobresalir y a ser uno de los mejores ganaderos de su zona. Todos los días está pendiente del desarrollo de sus queridas vaquitas y de su alimentación, con mucha delicadeza por las mañanas saca la leche que su querida esposa se encarga de repartir a sus clientes para la elaboración de quesos y postres dentro de su comunidad; también oferta su carne y en algunas oportunidades las vende en las ferias ganaderas de su ciudad.Tiene mucho deseo de incrementar el número de los animalitos en su establo y mejorar las condiciones de su alimentación a fin de que obtengan un desarrollo excepcional.

loans.use: Capital to improve the conditions of his livestock supply and increase their number.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. and her husband, Mr. Khai Kong were married in 1981 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of their sons is married and lives outside of the family home, and other one is in school. Their two daughters weave silk at home. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Her husband has been building wooden houses for three years. The couple is in the process of repairing their home.

Mrs. Sokha has been a weaver and a vegetable seller since she was young. These are skills that she learned from her mother. She sells vegetables in the morning at the village market and weaves silk at home at the afternoon. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who sells them in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$1000. With the loan, and the money they have saved, they want to finish their house.

loans.use: To add to her own money for finishing her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S., 52, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in retail sales. She and her husband sell to the villagers 6 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $208).

Maria has had 5 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Malia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to renovate her house and for her children's educational fees.

loans.use: Purchase building materials and inventory.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence Y. sells rice, oil, and other foodstuffs. She is married, but her husband's teaching income is not sufficient for Florence and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she seeks additional capital to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Dus Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dus Maiya M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 5 and 2 respectively.

Mrs. Dus Maiya M. and her husband Mr. Nucha Maharjanare both engaged in idol making. They make different types of traditional gods' idols. They make idols according to the demand of their customers. Nowadays in their area, the demand for idols is increasing so to meet the demand, they need to invest funds in their business but due to lack of funds they are unable to meet the demands of their customers. So Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials like wax, silver, bronze, etc. for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To grow five small businesses, including a cafeteria and shoe store

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. sells fish which she buys from fishermen, brings home for processing and preserving, and then sends to the market for sale at Enyaaye near Elmina.

Diana has received primary education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a policeman. Diana has been selling fish since 1988. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever-increasing customer demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Naaem

texts.en:
Naaem is a 52 year-old man who lives in a small village near the city of Nabatieh with his wife and two children. Naaem operates a mini-market where he sells cooking products and simple foods such as seeds, nuts, and candies. 

Naaem wants to diversify his selection of products in order to better accommodate his clients. He has asked for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to do so. This is the second time Naaem will be working with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of simple foods and merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Naila Maqbool Bashir Group

texts.en:
Naila baji is the wife of M. B.. Mr. B. makes wooden decorations and sells them in several gift shops. He learned this art from his father, because this is their family business. Naila baji resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan, where she has been living for the past 15 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Naila baji has a business sewing clothes. She does this work because she wants to give her children a good education. Naila baji successfully repaid her previous four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wood, polishers, and tools to make more wooden decorations. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Rashidan baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle, like a tuk-tuk). Bilquis Begum baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for making wooden decorations

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.en:
Members of the "Virgen D. las Mercedes" Village Bank live and meet in the town of Churcampa, in Huancavelica, a Department of central Peru. Churcampa is the provincial capital, and is located at 3300 meters above sea level. The zone is chilly, with rugged terrain. Churcampa trades heavily with the nearby city of Huancayo. Most of the community members are involved in commerce, while some farm and raise livestock. Farmers grow corn in Chucuampa’s low-elevation areas, and peas in higher elevation areas.

Felicitas and Cirila are two members of the "Virgen D. las Mercedes" group. Felicitas is married with five children: four of them are in their twenties, while the youngest is 13. Felicitas has a small restaurant, where she also sells sodas. She launched her business a year ago, when some local bank workers asked if she could cook them lunch. Felicitas’ business is going well; the only problem is that it is hard to find time to plant crops on her farm since she is so busy with the restaurant. Loans from FINCA have helped her buy utensils and offer a wider variety of meals and drinks to sell. She plans to use this loan of 500 soles to buy more dry goods (rice, flour sugar) and sodas. Felicitas’ goals for the future are to send her children to college and to expand her business even more. Cirila is married with four children, who are 28, 24, 21 and 17 years old. She has a small general store that she hopes to expand. She has been running her store for 15 years now, and supports her children with the money she earns. She says that when there was a lot of societal violence in the area (in the 1980s and 1990s, due to conflicts between the armed forces and the Shining Path) it was hard to run the store; she could only stay open until 5pm, since staying open later was unsafe and would make her vulnerable to robberies. She plans to use her loan of 400 soles to improve her business and buy more equipment. Her dreams for the future are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open a wholesale dry goods business. Working with FINCA has helped her save money in her savings account, which she plans to use for any difficulties she may encounter in the future.

loans.use: Buy rice, flour, sugar, sodas, equipment

loans.name: Irshad M. Shaban Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is a 40-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 5 years. She is the mother of one daughter who is just 5 years old. Irshad baji is a very responsible and hard-working lady. Her husband's name is M. S. and he is a mason. Irshad baji helps him to meet the financial expenses with her skill at embroidery. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she gets from her neighbors and earns profit from them. She uses her income to pay the kitchen expenses. Her husband is proud of her lovely and kind attitude. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband because he wants to start a transport business, because there’s little income in a mason's work.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim baji and Kaniz Fatima baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy iron to re-sell. Elahi baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for her for transport business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for transport

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse S. est veuve, mère de quelques enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle compte avec ce prêt poursuivre son activité de vente d’huile de palme. Elle s’approvisionne à Guinée Bissau pour revendre à Soutou. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse S. is widowed and the mother of a few children whom she supports. With this loan, she would like to develop her business, which consists of selling palm oil. She acquires her supply in Guinea Bissau to resale in Soutou. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire a supply of palm oil in Guinea for resale in Ziguinchor

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells fish and snails. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She sells fish wholesale and retail to her customers. She is 50 years old and married with 2 children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Phin Dim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank has sixteen members and is located in Prachum Angk Village, Kandal Province. The members will use their loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Phin D. is the village bank president, as selected by the members. She is 36 years old and the mother of five children; three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two attend a local school. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She cultivates in the dry season, but faces a problem because her field has infertile soil, which affects crop production. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the field and fuel for her water pump so she can make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sim Thea, is a construction worker who also works to support the family.

Note: Mrs. Sok Chanry, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Nine members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and fuel to make rice field more productive

loans.name: Twaiba

texts.en:
Twaiba has been a tailor in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns a very small monthly profit and works at her business for 12 hours.

She belongs to Hatutaki majungu group loan and is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items (clothes, needles, and white flour) for her duties. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Twaiba is 18 years old and she is married.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, needles, and white flour for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Ana es casada, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Ana junto a su esposo elaboran panes típicos de la región, actividad que realiza en el horno de su  suegro, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias de la región a donde viajan.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio y tener un horno propio.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of Señor de Huanca Community Bank. She is a 24-year-old married mother of three children. Ana along with her husband make breads typical of the region, which she does using the oven of her father-in-law. She sells the breads at the flea markets in the region she travels to. Ana is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which she plans to use to purchase flour. Her dreams are to improve her business and have her own oven.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence S. is 29 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. She says both of her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession. 
She trades in eggs. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in her community and nearby communities at affordable prices. Florence sells in the local market and also treks to other towns to sell. She distributes some eggs to retailers and beverage sellers. Florence has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can.

loans.use: To procure eggs in bulk

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
"Before, I was selling food items in the streets. I stopped selling when we started to grow rice for our livelihood. My husband is a farmer. He is the one who manages our small rice field. Our harvest is mainly intended for family use. When there is excess, we sell our rice to our neighbors," says Janeth E., 44-year-old mother of two children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will definitely help her expand her harvest and improve her income.

CEVI is help more people to start businesses. CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells baby clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, and feeding bottles as well as ladies skirts and blouses in her community. She is 51 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. She will use this loan to increase her stock of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials so she can increase her income to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of baby supplies

loans.name: Hamad Group

texts.en:
Hamad is the group leader of Hamad Group. There are three members in this group and they each want to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 42,000 Afghani.

Hamad wants to take a loan for his fruit-selling shop.

Zharmena wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Havfeza wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver.

So they are all happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan that is able to support all poor people.

loans.use: To expand his fruit-selling business

loans.name: Dorj

texts.en: Dorj G. is a 38-year-old, married, father of one. His family lives in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. His spouse Bujidmaa, 38, is unemployed. His only daughter Bujmaa, 16, is a local high school student. Dorj has been running a transportation business during the last 5 years. When he started his business he used to rent a mini bus from others for use as public transportation. Two years after he started his business he could save enough money to purchase a second hand mini bus. Since then he's been using his own mini bus for his business. He says that "My family's living condition has improves a lot since i started running transportation. Now i will start saving small amount to own an apartment in the future." With this loan Dorj will buy spare parts for his mini bus.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his mini bus.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S., age 56, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she sells various kinds of fruit at a local market in the city, typically earning approximately US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by her three children who are currently employed as electricity technicians with an income of US $5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase more various kinds of fruit to expand her business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: fruit purchase

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia tiene 44 años D. edad es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el sector San Antonio, distrito D. Pomalca, ubicado a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace tres años es propietaria D. un pequeño puesto en el mercado D. Pomalca, donD. venD. comida a las personas que frecuentan el lugar y a algunos pensionistas (clientes que acuden a ella todos los dias), ella se dedica a trabajar desD. muy temprano en la mañana hasta la tarD., con parte D. las ventas del día compra los ingredientes D. los platos que preparará al día siguiente.

Su esposo es jubilado y el dinero que percibe D. su jubilación no es suficiente para mantener su hogar, por este motivo se esfuerza todos los días para sacar adelante su negocio, ella desea ampliarlo con la finalidad D. atender a más comensales y en un futuro próximo ser propietaria D. un pequeño restaurante, por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar mas insumos D. cocina  y preparar la variedad D. platos suficientes para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es muy conocida entre sus compañeros del mercado D. Pomalca y es considerada por ellos como una mujer responsable y trabajadora que todos los dias trata D. salir adelante con su negocio para ayudar  con la economía diaria D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a 44-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the San Antonio sector of the district of Pomalca, located 10 minutes away from the city of Chilcayo.

For ten years, she has been the owner of a small stand in the market of Pomalca, in which she sells food to the market goers and some lodgers who frequent her stand every day. She starts working very early in the morning until the evening. She uses some of her daily profits to purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare the dishes for the next day.

Her husband is retired, but his retirement pension is insufficient to support the household. For this reason, she has to work hard every day to get ahead with her business. She hopes to expand with the aim of serving more patrons. She is requesting a loan for 1,000.00 PEN from our institute for the very first time, which will allow her to purchase ingredients and prepare a variety of dishes so that she can reach her goal. She is very well-known among her fellow vendors at the Pomalca market, and is considered to be a very responsible and hard-working woman who tries to move her business forward every day so that she can help with the household income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation and sales

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, detergents and other products in her grocery. She is 33 years old, widowed and has two children. Rahima has been running the grocery store for the past five years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Rahima is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Rahima is trying to sustain her business and has requested a loan of $800 US to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Rahima reach all of her aspirations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Plumkor Community Development Project. Group

texts.en:
Plumkor Community Development Project is a group of five borrowers led by Momo K., a 43-year-old married man. Momo has three children aged 8 to 13 years old with educational levels of 4th to 7th grade.

Momo is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support. He then decided to get into business. He lives in Plumkor Community which is a very poor and crowded community where people strive for their living. It is south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Momo's business is timber. He buys timber whole from rural Liberia and sells to the residents of Monrovia. He started this business through the efforts of friends. Because it was during the Liberian civil crisis that Momo started his business, he used to face difficulties from rebels that always seized his goods. But, because he kept his head up, he was always trying to succeed.

Momo maintains his customers by selling good timber. He has been running this business for nine years and is hoping to improve his business to a better standard. He needs this loan to buy more timber to improve business.

Momo dreams of assisting his family in generating funds that will provide upkeep and change their lives.

loans.use: To buy more timber to improve his business

loans.name: Omotude

texts.en: Omotude is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She sells medicines within her community in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre membres du groupe Saniya sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles font  comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente, de chaussures,  de charbon de bois,  de fruits,  des  condiments alimentaires,  de  la friperie etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Solidaire.  Le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 50 sacs de charbon de bois, 3 chargements de charrette  en oranges , 3 colis de condiments alimentaires ,12 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et  2 balles de friperie. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de KAMALEN SIRAKORO, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Saniya are essentially married women who average 43 years of age and 5 children each.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in KAMALEN SIRAKORO, one of the village in the Sikasso community (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They have revenue-generating work selling shoes, charcoal, fruit, condiments, second-hand clothing, etc.   The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers and are now on their second solidarity loan.  The previous loan was properly repaid.  With their new loan, they intend to buy:  3 cart-loads of oranges, 2 packets of condiments, 12 dozen pairs of plastic footwear, and 2 bales of used clothing.  Supplies are gotten at the Sikasso City marketplace and in neighboring villages.  Sales are make in cash and often on credit to customers composed of men and women at the KAMALEN SIRAKORO marketplace, by going door-to-door, and in homes.  The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 23,500 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be put into savings and used for the family.  The other portion will be invested in their businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La señora Olga Z. es un señora que demostró ser una buena madre que ante la situación económica saco a su hijo adelante que ahora es un padre de familia. Olga desde hace 18 años puso un negocio de comida hasta hacer un restaurante llamado “El tío Toto”, en el negocio ella vende variedad de platillos de la región.  Para poder seguir con su negocio ella esta requiriendo una estufa industrial por que la que tiene es pequeña y no abastece las ordenes del cliente, para no quedar mal recurre a nosotros para pedir apoyo económico para comprar su estufa con el fin de que el cliente se vaya satisfecho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Z. is a great mother who, beating all economic odds, provided and cared for her son, now a father and husband. Eighteen years ago, Olga started her food selling business, eventually setting up a restaurant, "El Tio Toto," at which she offers a variety of regional dishes. To continue her business, she needs an industrial stove; the one she currently has is small and cannot keep up with the customers' orders. She has asked Kiva partner FVP for financial assistance so that she can buy her stove and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying an industrial stove

loans.name: Ko´eju Group

texts.en: The Ko’eju Committee is a group of women entrepreneurs who invest capital from the Fundacion Paraguaya in their businesses. They have taken advantage of the skills and training workshops offered by the Fundacion, and support each other in their endeavors and other financial matters. They would like to thank those who have given them a chance to grow and improve their livelihood through microloans. Step by step they are bettering the quality of their lives and building brighter futures for themselves and their children. They have applied for a new loan to buy additional merchandise to sell to their customers.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Efe makes a living selling used handbags in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is married, has four children and is 38 years old. She is a highly-focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Efe has been in her line of work for a long time and is requesting for a loan to buy more used handbags to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy used handbags to sell to her customers

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Girasoles está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Patricia del Carmen G., Bismar de Jesús C. H. y Ana Cristina T.. Ellos son de Nindirí donde cada rincón de este pintoresco municipio está impregnado con la historia de nuestros ancestros desde la época precolombina.

Patricia del Carmen G. desde hace cuatro años vende ropa usada, ella comenzó siendo vendedora ambulante actualmente ideo improvisar en el porche de su casa un pequeño caramanchel para ofertar su producto. Pero esta joven de 28 años trabaja arduamente con la meta de  en tener una tienda adecuada para su negocio. 

Sus compañeros de Bismar de Jesús C. H. y Ana Cristina T. también comercializan ropa de manera ambulante ellos invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercadería en ropa especialmente uniformes que es lo que más se comercializa en está época.
texts.en:
The Girasoles group is made up of three hard-working, enterprising people: Patricia del Carmen G., Bismar de Jesús C. H. & Ana Cristina T.. They are from Nindirí whose every nook and cranny of this picturesque town is infused with the history of our ancestors back to pre-Columbian times. Patricia del Carmen G. has sold used clothing for the last four years. She began as a peddler but now has improvised a small, covered shed on her porch from which to offer her wares. This young, 28-year-old, woman works hard with the goal in sight to have her own well-equipped store. Her collegues Bismar de Jesús C. H. and Ana Cristina T. also are used clothing peddlers; they will use the funding to buy stock merchandise, especially school uniforms, which are big sellers this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Alvaro Willmark

texts.es:
El Sr. Alvaro tiene como actividad el servicio de seguridad integral ""Proteg""  empresa  que brinda seguridad a instituciones que asi lo requieran (seguridad  privada), incluyendo Emprender en sus agencias de la ciudad de La Paz, es un negocio familiar ya esta actividad la desarrolla conjuntamente con su hermano, constituyendose  en la principal fuente de ingreso para el y toda su familia, que esta compuesta por sus padres, hermano y su pequeño hijo.

El destino del credito sera principalmente para capital de trabajo, compra de uniformes de trabajo para sus empleados.
texts.en:
Alvaro’s business is providing comprehensive security. His company, Proteg, offers security (private security) to institutions that need it. This includes Emprender as one of their agencies in the city of La Paz. This is a family business because he develops it together with his brother. It is the primary source of income for him and his whole family, which is comprised of his parents, his brother, and his small child. The loan will be primarily for working capital to buy work uniforms for his employees.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work uniforms

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en: Elizabeth D. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 45 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Elizabeth is married and has five school-aged children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Elizabeth plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia B. is from the village of Magsaysay Street, San Pedro, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Cynthia is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Cynthia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables and cooking ingredients in the local community and in the local market. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

NOTE: The photo was taken while Cynthia was helping a customer.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mohpari

texts.ru: Рахматова Мохпари проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки и она занялась бизнесом. Торгует у себя дома. Занимается этим делом уже 4 года. Она в основном продает одежду. На полученный кредит хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en:
Mohpari R. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband left to go to Russia for work, and she started a business. She sells at home. Mohpari has been involved in this business for 4 years now. She mainly sells clothing. She wants to use this loan to expand the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ana Balbina

texts.es: Esta Señora es originaria del Municipio de Cinco Pinos, Departamento de Chinandega, solicita un crédito para mejorar su negocio, la cual fue destinado para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento, tubos, laminas de zinc, y herramientas, la cual le ha servido para prosperar su negocio y asi vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
This lady is originally from "Cinco Pinos." She is asking for this loan in order to improve her business. She will buy building materials and tools in order to improve her business and live with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and tools

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan trabaja en la prefectura del Departamento de La Paz a contrato, ya es independiente, y trabaja para solventar los gastos de estudios, de alimentación y vestimenta.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Central de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para educación (compra de una computadora, que lo utilizará para sus estudios en la universidad).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones de estudios..
texts.en:
Ivan has a contract working in the prefecture of the La Paz department. He is independent, and he works to pay for his educational expenses, his food, and his clothing. He lives in his grandparents’ house in the Central region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for his education (to buy a computer to use for his university studies). This is the third time he has asked Impro for a loan. With this loan he will be able to improve his educational circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer to continue his studies at the Accounting Institue

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es: La señora GIOCONDA O. trabaja para la Universidad católica de Nicaragua como conserge ellas tiene cuatro años de laborar y este es su primer préstamo que trabaja con CEPRODEL este lo quiere para mejorar el teccho de su casa ya que se aproxima el invierno.
texts.en:
La señora GIOCONDA O. trabaja para la Universidad católica de Nicaragua como conserge ellas tiene cuatro años de laborar y este es su primer préstamo que trabaja con CEPRODEL este lo quiere para mejorar el teccho de su casa ya que se aproxima el invierno.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mejorar el techo de su casa

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 25 years old, married to a driver, and has one child. She has been selling malimali (assorted household goods) and second-hand clothes for three years. She also does dairy farming to earn extra income. She uses her income to support her family and also saves with a group in Faulu Kenya called Ikinu Genesis. She uses her savings to invest in business. 

She has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her inventory of clothes and household goods, which includes buckets, utensils, basins and cloth bins. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and household goods for resale

loans.name: Abalo

texts.en: Abalo M. has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA to purchase 17 sacks of corn for his cereal selling business. He has worked selling corn and other grains for about 11 years. Abalo is 44 years old and married to another entrepreneur. He and his wife have four children. This is his first microloan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase corn for resale.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Rodolfo A.  es cliente recurrente, es casado y vive en casa propia.
El titular realiza trabajos de albañilería hace mas de 15 años,  a la vez tiene con su ganancias de su trabajo como albañil esposa un negocio donde invierte las ganancias que obtiene con su trabajo como albañil.
El negocio es administrada por su esposa y así se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunas herramienta que facilitara su trabajo albañil como una mezcladora.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodolfo A. is a returning client. He is married and he lives in his own house. He has been working in masonry for over 15 years. Meanwhile, with his earnings from his work as a mason, his wife opened a business where they continue to invest money earned in his work. The business is run by his wife and as such helps them both to move ahead. He is soliciting a loan in order to buy some tools which will facilitate his work as a mason, such as a mixer.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a mixer and other tools for masonry.

loans.name: John Paul

texts.en:
John Paul O., from the village of Port Area, Poblacion Iligan City, is 26 years old, single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, John Paul owns and operates a service-based business providing computer and internet services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, John Paul joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPF that was used to purchase materials needed to expand services, he is requesting a new loan, his third, of 11000 PHP for the same purpose. John Paul plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Deng

texts.en:
Dang T., 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorea Temples. T. is a farmer and raises pigs at home, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband (who appears in the photograph) is a farmer, growing rice for an income of $3 US per day. One of her children is a car repairman. 

T. is requesting a loan of $12,00 US to purchase car glass to expand her son’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy car glass to expand the son's business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia J. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 66 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Rogelia has a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rogelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rogelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Happy People Group

texts.en:
Paul K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Happy People'. Paul is 39 years old, married, and has two children, 6 and 13 years old. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, he has been operating a tailoring shop in Barnesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cloth.

Paul describes himself as an earnest person. His goal is to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman with four children, of whom three attend school and one is still too young for school. She has been operating her business of selling khangas (cloths worn as garments) for the last six years to her neighbors, especially women, from door to door. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a bale of khangas. Her major challenge is delay of payments by customers after selling on credit. Her major goal is to open a wholesale shop in the future. Asha decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business. She owns a house with electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of khangas.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2enfants et vivant dans des  familles monogames à MANCOURANI NATIEN, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce du vestimentaire et de l’alimentaire tels que les oignons avec KADIATOU D., qui compte acheter avec son  prêt,  8 sacs de 100kg d’oignon.
