Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Médine et dans les villages avoisinants de la ville de Sikasso. Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso ville et en famille  en détail, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the group called Sabaly are married women; on average, they are 38 years old and have two children each. The live in monogamous families in Mancourani Natien, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele, this is their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All of their previous loans have been fully reimbursed. This group of women have businesses selling clothes and food, such as onions. For example, Kadiatou Diabete intends to purchase eight 100 kilogram sacks of onions with her loan. She will purchase her supplies in the large market of Médine and in the towns neighboring the city of Sikasso. She will resell the goods in the large market of Sikasso and from her home at retail prices, for cash and often for credit. Her clientele is composed mostly of women. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 27.500 FCFA, one part of which she will use for her family's expenses and the rest she will re-invest in her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce P.  is currently in the business of selling cooked rice, beans, tea, etc. at her restaurant and she is requesting a loan to stock more food supplies to cook and sell from her restaurant. Joyce is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children and 3 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell from her restaurant.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia B. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 35 years old. Cresencia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cresencia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Cresencia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina G. is from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 40 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. Dina  runs a food stall where she sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Dina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dina is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Dina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old, widowed, and has five adult children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish  including danggit, pinikas, and tamban, in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional dried fish to buy and sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Fe's second loan  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

loans.name: Lourdes Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lourdes; ella tiene 28 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como : arroz,azucar,leche,menestras, golosinas entre otros,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con sus familias. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the "Mi Peru" community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old and single.  She has a grocery store, where she sells basic products, such as rice, sugar, milk, vegetables, sweets, and so on.  She is a hardworking woman, who really wants to get ahead.  She works together with her family.

Lourdes wants the loan to expand her small business and thus help her children get ahead.  She thanks you for supporting her and promises to meet her payments on time.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida M.  tiene 31 años de edad, está casada con el señor Roberto Fernández quien tiene 33 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Piribebuy, distante a unos 61 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Tiene tres hijos varones adolecentes.
 La señora Adelaida vive en el barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de Piribebuy, ella es peluquera y tiene su salón de belleza en el centro mismo de la ciudad.
 Por más que la señora Adelaida y su marido trabajen mucho, poseen algunas necesidades de mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra mercaderías y productos e insumos para su salón de belleza.
 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello podrá ofrecer un servicio excelente a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Adelaida M. is 31 and married to Roberto Fernández, 33.  They live in the city of Piribebuy, 61 kilometers from the capital (Asunción).  They have three teenage sons.
Adelaida lives in the San Antonio neighbor in Piribebuy.  She is a hairdresser and has a beauty shop in the center of the city.
As much as she and her husband work, they still lack some necessities to improve their standard of living.
She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise, products and supplies for her beauty shop.
She appreciates the support the Fundación Paraguaya has given her this way and also the excellent service it gives to the community.

loans.use: To buy supplies that she uses in her beauty shop

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es: Ana tiene 49 años D. edad es socia D. la Alcancía Comunal “Cristo Rey D. Nicolás D. Piérola” tiene 3 hijos menores, es enfermera D. profesión (pone inyectables D. forma particular) no lo ejerce debido a que ella desea pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, para lo cual decidió dedicarse a la repostería el ingreso D. este pequeño negocio le permitió comprar los materiales para elaborar tortas como moldes y algunos adornos que puedan llevar dichas tortas. Ella se dedica a esta labor desD. hace  20 años. Ana solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar más ingredientes y preparar tortas aprovechando las fiestas D. promociones D. los colegios  D. la zona donD. ella vive. Ella sueña con comprarse una cocina con horno que le permita preparar tortas en el menor tiempo posible pero su sueño más codiciado es tener un local y alquilarlo para fiestas y bufetes.
texts.en: Ana is 49 and is a member of the Cristo Rey D. Nicolas D. Pierola Community Bank. She has three young children and is a nurse (doing injections) by profession, but she does not practice because she wants to spend more time with her children. Thus, she decided to work in baking. The income from this small business has allowed her to purchase materials for making pies, such as molds and various decorations for the pies. She has worked in this business for 20 years. Ana is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to purchase more ingredients and prepare pies, taking advantage of the upcoming graduation festivities for the schools in the area where she lives. She dreams of buying herself a kitchen with an oven to prepare pies in as little time as possible, but her greatest dream is to have a location and rent it out for parties and dinners.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for pies

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es:
Don Francisco Alberto J., es Profesor Titular en el Departamento de Ciencias Sociales de la Universidad de Ingeniería (UNI), desde hace 21 años.
Es casado, con 2 personas a su cargo.
El solicita el dinero para una operación de Retina, y elaboración de suturación de la misma. Lleva 5 créditos pagados a CEPRODEL, los que ha utilizado para gastos de medicina, vivienda, escolares y gastos personales.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Alberto J. has been an Associate Professor in the Department of Social Sciences at the Engineering University (UNI) for the past 21 years.
He is married, with 2 dependents.
He is requesting this money for retina surgery and subsequent retina stitches. He has paid back 5 loans from CEPRODEL, which he has used for medicine, housing, educational and personal expenses.

loans.use: Retina surgery and subsequent retina stitches

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Mrs. Rida S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Phally Bun, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have 3 young children: two sons and one daughter. 

Mrs. Rida S. sells finished silk fabric. She buys it from the fellow weavers in her village and transports it to sell at different places far away from her home. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh.

She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for another loan of $600 to purchase additional finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: Félix Manuel tiene 1 hijo que asiste a un colegio público, ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para mantenerlos en un privado. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de pintura y soldadura, que está ubicada de manera ambulante. Inicio este medio de vida por su Padre quien le enseño este negocio, para que el pudiera mantenerse. Ahora está solicitando un financiamiento que será utilizado para la compra de materiales. Félix tiene el sueño de incrementar su negocio para que el día de mañana esto le asegure el futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Félix Manuel has one son who is in public school. He does not earn enough of an income to send him to private school. He works as a street vendor and  provides a paint and welding service. He started doing this through his father who taught him the business so that he could support himself. Now he is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase materials. Félix has a dream to expand his business so that one day he can assure his child's future.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. In addition to her business, she serves as reflexologist/midwife in their community to earn additional income. Her husband Gil, who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 11 children who are between 16 and 36 years old. Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy fishing net and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Wilma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii J. M. is a 41-year-old woman. She is married to Ali Mohamed and they have been blessed with four children. Mealii is a landlady in Miritini, Mombasa and has been in this business for the last eight years. Her business has been a success.

This marks her third loan from KADET, and she plans to renovate her rental houses. She anticipates some profits which she plans to redirect into the construction of more residential houses on her land. Her future dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita, 53 years old, earns a living through farming. She grows rice that she sells to the people in her community. She is also a fruit vendor. She buys from other fruit sellers and resells the fruits near a school. Some of the fruits that she sells come from her garden.

Sanita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. Sanita works hard to improve her family's living conditions. This loan will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pauline  Akinyi

texts.en:
Pauline Akinyi O. has been a tailor for one year and earns an income of KES. 15,000 per month. Her business is located in the Babadogo region in Nairobi, and most of her clients are residents of the same region.

She is married to Nelson and they are blessed with five school-going children. She learned about KADET LTD through a friend. She is applying for her first loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase more fabric for dresses.

She will use income from the proceeds of this loan to invest back into the business, and also to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make dresses

loans.name: Joselin

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Joselin L. que tiene la edad de 32 años, ella es profesora y es ta casada tiene dos hijos que asisten al preescolar de la comunidad.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año inicio con su propio negocio de venta de zapatos por catalago, ella vende sus zapatos con sus compañeros de trabajo, amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.ella lleva sus catalagos con sus clientes, levanta un pedido, lo encarga con sus provedores y cuando llega el paquete  entrega sus productos y recibe su pago. ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que la situacion economica cada dia esta mas dificil y el dinero no alcanza, tambien porque quiere iniciar a horrar para en un futuro poder pagarles una profesion a sus hijos.

Doña joselin necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos y catalagos para poder realizar su venta.
ella nos dice que espera que con esta invercion su negocio cresca y tanga mas clientes para que su venta y negocio cresca ya que en un futuro le gustaria poner una pequeña zapateria en la comunidad, ella tiene la esperanza de que cuando la ponga vender mucho yaque aun no existe este tipo de tiendas en su comunidad.
ella esta muy agradecida con la fundacion por el prestamo otorgado ya que no solo le ayudar en su negocio sino tambien podra darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita.  It is noted for the fact that it is the only community for several kilometers that has a senior high school.  32 year-old Joselin L. is a teacher.  She is married and has two children who are in pre-school in the community.

Joselin tells us that a little over a year ago she started her own business selling shoes through a catalog.  She sells shoes to her work colleagues, friends and neighbors in her community.  She takes the catalogs to her customers, fills in their orders, orders the products from her suppliers and, when the package arrives, she delivers her products and receives payment for them.  She decided to start working in her own business because the financial situation is becoming more and more difficult every day and money doesn't reach far enough.  She also wants to save for the future so that she can pay for her children to study towards a profession.

Joselin needs this loan to invest in buying shoes and catalogs so that she can make her sales.  She tells us that she hopes this investment will help her business to grow and that she will gain more customers so that her sales and business grow.  In the future, she would like to set up a small shoe store in her community.  She hopes that she will be able to sell a lot because there is no other store of this kind in her community.

Joselin is very grateful to Fundación Realidad for granting her this loan since it will help her not only in her business but also in providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita B. is 66 years old and married. Conchita works very hard.

She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. Conchita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Reut

texts.en:
Reut is a 24-year-old single man, supporting his parents. His monthly income is KES 1,000.

He has been a farmer for the past five years. Maize farming is doing well is his area due to favorable conditions.

He learned about KADET Ltd. through advertisement done by KADET. He has been a good client. He repaid the previous loan well. 

He has applied for a third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, with which he plans to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He has never taken a loan from another microfinance institution.

He is a genuine man who will struggle to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ramón Ignacio

texts.es:
Ramón Ignacio P. se siente orgulloso de su negocio, en el cual le presta el servicio a la comunidad de lavado de todo tipo de muebles para el hogar, labor que ha desempeñado durante 5 años en compañía de su familia. 

Hoy Ramón continúa con el mismo empuje y ganas de progresar, lo que le ha permitido crecer su negocio, pues trabaja diariamente de 7:000 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. con la ilusión se convertir su microempresa en un legado para sus 2 hijos.

En el futuro Eduardo se visualiza como un gran empresario, para ello trabaja fuertemente y sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Sin embargo actualmente Ramón necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina hidrolavadora que le facilitara el proceso y la calidad en el servicio.
texts.en:
Ramón Ignacio P. feels very proud of his business which offers all types of home furniture shampooing in his community.  With the help of his family he has had the business for five years 
Today Ramón continues with the same drive and desire to progress which has helped his business grow.  He works every day from 7 am to 5 pm with the dream of building a micro enterprise to leave his 2 children.

He pictures a big business in the future and will work, hard and he dreams of improving the quality of life for his family.  Now Ramón needs a loan to buy a shampooing machine which will simplify the work and the quality of his service.

loans.use: To buy a furniture shampooing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Emboscada.
Todas las integrantes del comité participan de forma activa y solidaria.Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Vicenta es una de las integrantes del comité.Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 4  hijos y su marido es empleado.
 Se dedica  a la  venta de comidas, hace varios años que se dedica a esto así que ya tiene la clientela bien definida y le gustaría expandirse.
Se define como una buena cocinera ya que sus platillos son del agrado de sus clientes. Sueña con tener un gran puesto de comida donde podrá deleitar a los clientes con sus platos.
Solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos para la preparación de sus platillos como ser las carnes, verduras,especias, fideos y demás. Cree que el credito le sera de gran ayuda para cumplir con sus sueños
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) committee was formed by the joining together of several neighbors from the city of Emboscada.

All the members of the committee participate actively and cooperatively.  They form a very untied group that is capable of carrying out joint activities that strengthen their companionship.

Vicenta is one of the committee members.  She has a very unified family with four children and an employed husband.

She has been selling prepared meals for several years so she has a well defined customer base but she’d like to expand.

She defines herself as a good cook since her dishes satisfy her customers.  She dreams with having a great food stand where she can tantalize her customers’ taste buds with her dishes.

She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients needed to prepare her dishes such as meats, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc.  She believes that the loan will be of great help to reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and nails.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children.

Alfredo is a rice farmer. He has had this kind of living for 10 years. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for rice fields.

Alfredo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice fields

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is 43 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has five children and earns a living by selling fish. She has been in this line of work for two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for a year and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 45 years old and married to a businesswoman, lives in Kakata where he is the father of two children, ages 19 and 26, who are presently attending school. For the past three years, Joseph has been selling water by sack and bottles wholesale in the community. Because he is the only one who is involved in this business, he makes substantial profits, and is now requesting a loan to purchase soap, cream, rice, oil, etc. to add to his business. Joseph plans to build a house for his children in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase soap, cream, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok is 63 years old and is a single mother who lives with her two children. She earns 8 USD daily from her business selling food. Together, her children earn 7 USD a day. Pok’s monthly expenses include 90 USD on food, 8 USD on electricity, 5 USD on transportation, and 10 USD on other expenses.

Pok is requesting a 300 USD loan to buy construction materials for her son’s business career. She hopes that he will be able to keep his business running well so that he will be able to better support the family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her son's business

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en: Souheir is a 24-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her father. She has owned a tailoring shop since 2007 and has more than five years of experience in silimar work. She specializes in sewing clothes and stitching designs onto them. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase textiles and pearls in order to increase her productivity and expand her business operation to earn more profit. This will be her second Kiva loan and we note that she has been a very good client with payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and pearls

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 3 hijos mayores e independientes, ella está casada.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años y se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una chacra donde invierte todo su préstamo para la siembra de hortalizas, que luego trae a vender al mercado de la ciudad
Con su nuevo préstamo S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ kilo de  semilla de tomate, ½ kilo de semilla de culantro, ½ kilo de semilla de col, 2 kilos de semilla de frejol, ½ kilo de semilla de vainitas, 2 kilos de semilla de maíz, 2 kilos de semilla de maní.
Son productos que la gente de este lugar utiliza diariamente en sus comidas, según el tiempo llega a tener un buen precio y eso es lo que aprovechan los agricultores, de esa manera sienten que su trabajo es recompensado.
Lucinda agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado a las mujeres que quieren sacar adelante a sus sfamilias.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucinda is a member of Mujeres Productivas in Manantay district, Ucayali department. She has three grown children, who are self-supporting, and she is married.

She has been receiving loans from Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for three years and is a farmer, who beings her crops to market in the city. 

With her new loan of 1,000 nuevo soles, she will buy ½ kilo of tomato seeds, ½ kilo of cilantro seed, ½ kilo of cabbage seed, 2 kilos of bean seed, ½ kilo of snap bean seeds, 2 kilos of corn seed and 2 kilos of peanut seed. These are products that people in the area use daily in their meals. Depending on the weather, such crops can earn a good price and that is what the farmers try to profit from. In this way, they feel that their work is rewarded. 

Lucinda is grateful to Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for all the help provided women who want to help their families get ahead.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is single, has no children and lives in a house that has electricity and piped-in water. His greatest monthly expense is food. He earns a living by supplying various residents in Kwale town with bread. His main challenges are having enough bread to sell and providing his customers with credit when they need it. Victor is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy more bread to sell and more crates to store it in. He joined Yehu as a way to secure the funds he needs to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell and crates to store it in.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en: Samart, who is 39 years old, buys and sells recycled items in Phnom Penh City, earning $4 per day. Samart doesn’t have any children and lives with her parents, who are farmers earning $3 per day. Every month, Samart has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rent, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a plot of land for farming. The loan will help her have a field that can provide some rice to support her family. She also wants to expand the area at her house where she stocks recycled items to sell when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina, 53, is a married woman with 11 children. Her children are between 4 and 27 years old.

Esterlina is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Esterlina works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school. 

She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Esterlina hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Annie

texts.es: Annie, de 38 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora. Es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 8 años quienes son fruto de su convivencia con su pareja, ella tiene una casa propia en donde comparte todos los días el gusto de criar a sus hijos y trabajar mucho para brindarles lo mejor. Además de ellos, también vive un joven que les ayuda en el trabajo que realizan a diario. EL trabajo de Annie consiste en el aserrío de madera cortada de forma legal y realizando la reforestación reglamentaria como le exigen la leyes D. estado. Tiene un pequeño mini aserradero en donde elaboran listones. Su local esta en la casa de su madre y lleva trabajando ya por 10 años continuos en esta actividad. Recibe la ayuda de siete ayudantes a quienes contrata y siempre les tiene al día en sus pagos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre hay movimiento y tienen salida a diario de sus productos, ya que es proveedora de algunas constructoras de la ciudad. Le esta yendo muy bien y espera poder ampliar su negocio, pues desea comprar más maquinas de aserrío. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos y adquirir dichas maquinas. Por otro lado se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas como en el préstamo anterior, además se muestra muy contenta con su grupo ya que son personas muy responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, comprará una maquina más para poder seguir trabajando con su negocio, asimismo comprará una medidora para que sus listones tengan mejor calidad en su acabado.
texts.en:
Annie, who is 38 years old, is a brave woman and a fighter. She is the mother of 2 children, ages 17 and 8, who are the fruit of her relationship with her partner. She has her own house where she shares every day in the joy of raising her children and working a lot to give them the best. Besides Annie and her family, there is also a youth who helps them with daily tasks. Annie's work consists of milling wood, cut legally, and then working toward regulatory reforestation as the laws demand in the state. 

She has a small mill where strips of wood are prepared. Her business is in her mother's house and she has already worked for 10 continuous years in this field. She receives the help of seven employees for whom she has always been on time with their pay. What she likes from her work is that there is always movement and they have daily sales from their products, since she is the supplier for some construction companies in the city. 

Things are going very well and she hopes to be able to grow her business. She wishes to buy more wood-cutting machines. This will be the second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and therefore she hopes for a small loan in order to accomplish her objectives and acquire these machines. In addition, she is committed to paying off her loan in a punctual manner, like she did with the previous loan. Also, she is very content with her group since they are very responsible and supportive people.  With the requested amount, she will buy one more wood-cutting machine in order to be able to continue working with her business and likewise she will buy one measuring tool so that her strips of wood have better quality upon completion.

loans.use: to buy one wood-cutting machine in order to be able to continue working with her business and one measuring tool so that her strips of wood will be of better quality upon completion.

loans.name: Sedjlo Group

texts.fr: SEDJLO est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Eugénie Akouavi. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Eugénie Akouavi est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Epyphane. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Eugénie Akouavi vit avec son mari et son enfant. Eugénie Akouavi n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Eugénie Akouavi mène comme activité la vente de boissons et des produits divers (biscuits, etc.) dans son quartier depuis quatre ans. Eugénie Akouavi s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus , l'aidant ainsi à assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Eugénie Akouavi et aux autres membres du groupe SEDJLO de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
SEDJLO is a group comprised of three persons whose representative (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Eugénie Akouavi. The group members reside in the same district. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Eugénie Akouavi is 37 years old and married to a mason by the name of Epyphane. They have one child in school to support. Eugénie Akouavi lives with her husband and child and has never been to school. To support herself, she has had a business selling beverages and various goods (cookies, etc.) in her area for four years. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. This business generates income for her, thus it helps her to cover the various family expenses. 

This second loan will surely allow Eugénie Akouavi and the other members of the group SEDJLO to boost their business and increase their customer base, as well as their revenues.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en: Hussam is a 21-year-old single man. He has a scarfs and cosmetics shop which is his only source of income. Hussam wants to purchase a new collection of scarfs for the winter season and a better collection of cosmetics to resell and improve his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN. When Hussam gets the loan, he will pay to purchase a new collection of scarfs and cosmetics. Then he will have more items to compete and increase his sales and income to live in better conditions. Hussam is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more scarfs and cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 29-year-old married man with two children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For the past five years, he has been working in the agricultural sector. Godfrey's major business challenge is seasonality.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy beans to plant. In the future, his dream is to venture into mechanized farming.

loans.use: to buy beans to plant

loans.name: Solutions Group

texts.en: Tinomuda, center, is a 35 year-old, married woman from Masvingo with 3 children aged 16, 9 and 5 — all of them still going to school. Tinomuda has a business raising poultry which she has operated for 6 years. She runs this business from her place of residence with the help of her young sister. She has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy chicks and feed. With this the extra income generated from this loan, Tinomuda will be able to feed her family as well as paying school fees on time. She says her challenge is shortage of capital which results in her buying low-cost chicks that do not grow well. She is planning to commercialize her business since she is doing it on a small scale.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 52 years old and is married to Mumbua.  They are blessed with three children. Solomon has been running a retail shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of Kes 30,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd. of Kes 20,000, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Souhair

texts.en:
Souhair is a 46 year old married woman from AL Hashmi Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements, She wants to improve her family living standard.
Souhair not prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her husband .

loans.use: to bay for her home improvements

loans.name: Icler

texts.es: Don Icler tiene 29 años, nació  en la provincia Jose Maria Linarez del departamento de Potosi, estudio hasta tercero de secundaria, desde niño ayudo a sus padres en la agricultura, tiene bastante experiencia el rubro de la agricultura, hace 9 años que trabaja de forma independiente tiene sus propias parcelas para producción, aun principio le fue  dificultoso independizarse porque no contaba con recursos económicos para el inicio de la actividad, la ayuda que le brindaba su padre con mano de obra no le abastecía, a un principio él se propuso comenzar a producir yuca y arroz de pronto pensó en sacar un crédito, para su producción de maracuyá, le fue bien comenta, ahora nuevamente solicita para ampliar una tienda de abarrotes que tiene su esposa, es por tal razón que él solicita un préstamo esto le ayudara  incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Icler is 29 years old.  He was born in the Jose Maria Linarez province in the department of Potosi and studied until the third year of secondary school.  Since he was a child, he has helped his parents with farming.  He has a lot of experience with agriculture.  He has worked independently for nine years.  He has his own plots of land.  At the beginning, it was difficult to become independent because he did not have the financial resources to start up.  His father helped him with labor, but it was not sufficient.  He started out planting yucca and rice and quickly decided to take out a loan to produce passion fruit.  This went well for him, so now he is requesting a loan to expand his wife's grocery store.  The loan will help them and increase their income, which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to expand his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Erick, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 31-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and three children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Litein, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past five years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming.

Erick passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and another quality breed of dairy cow. The dairy unit will assist Erick in managing his cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions. Erick also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenyan Shillings per liter and through this loan he will be making more money.

Before Erick joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Erick now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into becoming self-reliant. With the loan, Erick will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Erick will achieve this.

An increase in income will allow Erick to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Erick fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

You can help Erick to be closer to his goals, and a loan will do that.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and has four children. Marivic is married and has four children are still in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marivic has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Francis Auralina

texts.en: My name is Francis R. and I own a food stand that sells products such as tortillas with cheese, quesadillas, tacos, enchiladas, bread with beans and natural fruit drinks.  I have had my business for two years, and my sister helps me to wait on clients.  My food stand is located near a construction site, and during mealtimes all the construction workers come to my stand to purchase food.  They are all good people, and loyal customers.  My goal is to increase my inventory because my products sell very quickly.  I would like to use the profits from my business to buy a house for my family.

loans.use: To buy tortillas, cheeses, butter, meat, vegetables, drinks, fruit, beans, and bread for my business.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married and has two grown daughters. She has quite a varied work background. After finishing her schooling she worked for awhile in construction applying stucco finish to walls and buildings. Later she changed jobs and became a cleaner in an office building. The money she was making was not enough to support the basic needs of her family, however, so she decided to start her own business. For the last five years, she has had a small vending kiosk selling children’s clothing in the central city market. It is the only source of income for her family. Katerina realizes the value of lending services which have promoted growth and contributed to the success of her small business. She has maintained a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”, repaying a total of ten loans. Currently, she has built up around $2,000 of working capital. Her monthly gross profit amounts to $800. Katerina is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy assorted inventory. She is planning to refresh her clothing supply with a variety of pajamas, t-shirts, socks and other clothing. One of Katerina’s long-term plans is to open a new vending facility in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk. She believes that her optimism and tenacity in combination with financial assistance will continue to move her toward success and higher profits.

Катерина – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дочок. Вона змінила багато місць роботи. Закінчивши школу, вона певний час працювала в сфері будівництва штукатурницею. Потім змінила роботу, працювала прибиральницею. Однак, грошей, які заробляла Катерина, катастрофічно не вистачало, щоб забезпечити нагальні потреби її родини. Саме тому вона вирішила почати власний бізнес. На протязі останніх п’яти років вона є власницею торгової точки з продажу дитячого одягу на центральному ринку міста. Цей бізнес є єдиним джерелом прибутку для усієї родини. Катерина розуміє, що кредитні послуги сприяли розвитку її малого бізнесу та допомогли їй досягти успіху в бізнесі. У Катерини чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”, вона вчасно сплатила усі десять позик. Зараз в неї приблизно 2000 доларів робочого капіталу. Щомісячний дохід складає 800 доларів. Катерина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити нові піжами, футболки, шкарпетки та інший одяг. В майбутньому Катерина планує відкрити нову торгову точку в Івано-Франківську. Вона вважає, що її оптимізм та наполегливість у поєднанні з фінансовою допомогою допоможуть їй і надалі досягати успіху в бізнесі та отримувати стабільний прибуток.

loans.use: To get assorted inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling of prepaid cards

loans.name: Raúl Fernando

texts.es:
Raul is married and he lives in Creel, Chihuahua, Mexico. His wife is a teacher. They have 3 children. To provide a better quality of life to his family, Raul decided to start his own business selling used parts (junkyard). He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to satisfy the high demand, he now needs a loan in the amount of $200 USD wich he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repay this amount within 2 months. Be part of of this business and of Raul's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl es casado y vive en la localidad de Creel, en el estado de Chihuahua, su esposa es maestra y tiene tres hijos. Para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ante la falta de empleo Raúl decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de refacciones usadas, él conoce de este negocio y esta es la razón por la que puede ofrecer un buen servicio, con lo que ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 2 meses. Sé parte importante en la vida de Raúl y su familia, apóyalos en el desarrollo y crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.en:
Eudelio is synonymous with young, successful entrepreneur, because at age 27, he has been able to establish himself financially. He's married to 23 year old Alba Mabel Estigarribia and they have a 2 year old son.

Before getting married, he worked for five years at a shop in Asuncion that was run by Korean immigrants. Later he decided to set off on his own, selling pants and other clothing items on credit in the Carapegua area.

Four years ago, a relative invited him to travel to the city of Posadas, on the border with Argentina, to sell the artisanal products of Carapegua, blankets and hammocks, as well as other products like shoes and embroidered Ao Poi shirts (Ao Poi is a traditional textile that can be attached to other products and simulates a spider web). He currently has an established clientele.

Because of his hard work, he now owns a lovely house and is able to give his wife and son a more dignified life. He is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as shoes, shirts, pants hammocks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eudelio un sinónimo de joven emprendedor y triunfador ya que con su 27 años ha logrado formarse económicamente, está casado con la señora Alba Mabel Estigarribia, de 23 años, tienen un hijo de 2 años. Antes de casarse estuvo trabajando en una casa comercial en Asunción con unos inmigrantes coreanos por más de cinco años, luego se decidió a trabajar por cuenta propia, empezando a vender pantalones y otros productos a cuota por la zona de Carapeguá. Hace 4 años, un familiar le invitó a ir a la ciudad de Posadas de Argentina (país que limita con Paraguay) para la venta ambulante de los productos artesanales de Carapeguá que son las frazadas y hamacas, así como otros productos como ser zapatos, camisas bordadas de Aó Poí (tejido típico del país que sirve como aplique para diferentes tipos de prendas, es una imitación de la telaraña). Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada, gracias a ese duro trabajo hoy está terminada una linda vivienda propia y así puede brindar a su esposa y a su hijo una vida más digna. El crédito ha solicitado para la compra de mercaderías como zapatos, camisas, pantalones, hamacas, etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as shoes, pants, shirts, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Nasiyat

texts.en: Nasiyat (her husband is pictured) began her business 4 years ago. She is 46 years old, married, and has six children. She lives with her family in Khachmaz region, in the Yeni-Hayat settlement. Her business gives her opportunities to provide for her family. She would like a loan of $825 to buy a cow. Nasiyat's family wants to improve their business and increase their income.

loans.use: Nasiyat would like to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mumun

texts.en: Mumun is 27 years old and has an 11-year-old child. She has a small grocery store where she sells snacks and household goods. She can earn about US$ 20 per day. Her husband, S., is a motorcycle driver who earns US$ 2.50 per day. Mumun is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods for her grocery store. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Abdukaumov

texts.en: Abdukaumov A. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan). Abdukaumov A. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended himself as a serious and responsible client. His business stability and income increase helped him to return, in time, the previous loan and to improve his business situation. Mr. Abdukaumov A. is experienced in the business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in  livestock because he has been engaged in  livestock from the early years when he helped his father raise and sell cows and sheep. Besides he is engaged in  agricultural production and rice cultivation. It is the family business  started by his father. In time, he dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull for further livestock breeding. Now Mr. Abdukaumov A. requests the loan of $300 for business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for the business development and the further horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Narirurwe West A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hadija N.. She currently has a butcher shop and is requesting a loan to set up more butcher shops. Hadija is 48 years old, and married. Her husband has a butcher shop and also trades animal skins. She has 12 children ranging in age from 8 to 24, and 6 of them go to school.

Each week, Hadija makes approximately 20000 UGX (approximately $11.00) profit. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to trade more bags of charcoal. Previously, Hadija had a loan from BRAC Uganda 100000 UGX in order to set up a butcher stall, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hadija is joined in her small group by Zam Nabiryo, Joweria N., Hanifa N., and Margret G.. Zam Nabiryo sells used clothes and wants to get a permanent place to conduct business. Joweria N. currently is operating a business selling used clothing and wants a loan to purchase more bags of clothes to sell. Hanifa N. has a retail shop and wants to increase the stock in her shop. Margret G. is currently raising cattle and selling charcoal, and is requesting a loan to buy more Friesian cows.

loans.use: To open more butcher shops

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru:
Halim is 23 year old married man. He needs a loan to help him maintain his cattle breeding business. In the first half of January, cold and dry weather that predominated in Tajikistan seriously harmed Tajik ahriculture and livestock farming. Tajik cattle breeders found themselves in a difficult situation because they didn't have enough cattle food. They only had a half of the needed amounts of hay in their reserves. However, slottering the cattle at that point in time wasn't profitable. To resolve his problem, Halim requested a loan from Miconvest. The loan helped him to restore his cattle food reserves and continue maining his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Халим женат, ему 23 года. Ему необходимы деньги для приобретения и разведения скота. Хлодная и засушливая погода, стоявшая в Таджикистане в первой половине января, нанесла серьезный урон по таджикскому сельскому хозяйству и животноводству. Таджикиские скотоводы попали в затруднительное положение - кормить скотину скоро будет нечем. Заготовлено лишь меньше половины необходимого количества сена, причем в некоторых хозяйствах коровам дают сено из запасов на зиму. Однако и забивать животных невыгодно. Для этого, Халим как и другие скотоводы попал в затруднительное положение. В решение проблемы ему помог, получивший кредит в Микроинвест. Он запасся сразу кормом для скота, что стало легче содержать скот.

loans.use: To restore the cattle food reserves

loans.name: Petronila Susana's Group

texts.es:
Fortunita, Petronila and Hilda have belonged to the group Banco Comunal Legion for 1, 10 and 6 years, respectively.

Fortunita lives with her partner, she is 34 years old and has 4 children. Fortunita sells cosmetics through catalog orders. She also has a scooter-taxi that she rents out.

Petronila is a widow, she is 60 years old and has 5 children, she sells cheeses as a traveling saleswoman in the Santa Clara market.

Hilda is married, she is 30 years old and has two children. She travels to the markets where she sells grocery items and brings back cereals and small animals. She also has a restaurant where she works as the cook.

Fortunita, Petronila and Hilda need a loan of 1750 soles, 750 soles and 750 soles, respectively, money which will be invested in purchasing perfumes, lipglosses, creams, cheeses, sugar, rice and cereals.

The dream of these three women is to have their own restaurant, a bigger business, a stable location and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Fortunita, Petronila e Hilda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legión hace 1, 10, 6 años respectivamente.

Fortunita es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita vende cosméticos al crédito por catálogos. Además Fortunita tiene un mototaxi que alquila.

Por otro lado Petronila es viuda, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Petronila vende quesos de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara.

Mientras que Hilda es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Hilda viaja a las ferias donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias trae cereales, animales menores. Además Hilda trabaja en un restaurante como cocinera.

Fortunita, Petronila e Hilda necesitan un préstamo de 1750 soles, 750 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, labiales, cremas, queso, azúcar, arroz, cereales.

Los sueños de Fortunita, Petronila e Hilda son tener un restaurante propio, un negocio más grande, un puesto estable y construir su casa.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of perfumes, lipgloss, creams, cheese, sugar, rice and cereals.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is business-focused and very determined to improve her business. Cecilia is 49 years old and married; she has 7 children and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for 8 years. Cecilia sells drinks and water, and she needs the sum of $1200 to buy more drinks and water from the producers so that she can serve her customers better. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for the company

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia is requesting her eighth loan that she will invest in improvements in her house. She is adding a new room. She is a teacher of Middle School at the Institute Rubén Darío. She has two children: the oldest is 18 years old and he is studying his fifth year of middle school and a 14-year-old younger daughter who studies 2nd year in the Institute Rubén Darío. In spite that she is single, she is a very responsible and a model mother with her children. Mrs. Rosa Idalia is very thankful with AFODENIC since with all the loan granted by the institution she has been able to improve little by little her house. At present she is studying a Bachelor’s Degree at the URACCAN University. Her dream is to be a working professional with a lot of experience, she wants to have labor stability and have a house with all the conditions so her two children can keep on studying.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Idalia está solicitando su octavo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es la construcción de una habitación. Trabaja como docente de Educación Secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío. Tiene dos hijos: el mayor de 18 años de edad el cual esta estudiando su quinto año de educación secundaria y la hija menor de 14 años estudia 2do año en el Instituto Rubén Darío, a pesar que es una madre soltera es una madre ejemplar y muy responsable con sus hijos. Doña Rosa Idalia se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos otorgados por la institución ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura en la Univesidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es ser una profesional con mucha experiencia, estabilidad laboral, tener una casa con las todas las condiciones y que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch Y., 56, is married and lives with her husband, Chhem Cheng, in the Kampong Cham province. They have four children, but they have all been married and moved out of the home. Touch is a farmer who typically makes US$2.30 each day, while her husband collects palm juice and refines it to sugar palm. Sugar palm is considered to be very delicious and is very popular among Cambodians. He takes the sugar palm and sells it in the local food market, making US$1 each day. They would like to see their income increased, but do not see a lot of room for expanding their current businesses. Touch Y. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase some land close to the market so that she can open up a grocery store. She believes this investment can allow her family to improve its current economic condition and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase land to open grocery store

loans.name: Mwanakombo's Uvivu Si Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 54 years old. She is married and she has two children aged 8 and 10. She is a chicken and bread seller. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 5 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $255 from her sales.

Mwanakombo now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Fatma, who has a business selling snacks.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: This the fourth time that Mrs. Chhoun T. has asked for a loan to improve her business activities. She is a farmer who grows cabbage and garlic in her field, which is located in Preak Talai Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Chea Ngov, is a cow breeder who raises two cows, and he also assists with his wife's business. Mrs. Chhoun T. is now facing a small problem with her plantation, because she does not have enough money to purchase more Chinese garlic to grow. Thus, Mrs. Chhoun T. is requesting a loan to for this purpose. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer, and fuel for her pump. Mrs. Chhoun T. is 49 years old and the mother of a child who is attending high school.

loans.use: To purchase more Chinese garlic, fertilizer, and fuel for her pump.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, es de las mujeres que no se enfoca en un solo producto de venta, sino que amplía su negocio con nuevos productos, a base de que analiza y observa las necesidades de sus vecinos. Su tienda es una de las más concurridas en la zona, no sólo por la variedad de productos, sino también por los costos razonables, esto demuestra que Judith tiene una capacidad de venta, utilizando sus nociones de marketing en su negocio y hasta ahora le esta yendo muy bien. Además, por ser su comunidad un lugar alejado de la ciudad, los pobladores tienen muchas necesidades, esto contribuye al éxito del negocio de Judith, que gracias a que hay una buena carretera, puede transportar sus productos de la ciudad a su poblado. Ahora, tiene la necesidad de invertir en nueva mercadería, para lo cual requiere de su apoyo y solicita un préstamo, dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos nuevos productor para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Judith is a woman who doesn’t focus on a single product to sell, but rather enlarges her business with new products, on a basis of what she analyses and observes her neighbours to need. Her store is one of the most crowded in the area, not only because of the variety of products, but also for the reasonable costs. This demonstrates that Judith has a talent in sales, using her marketing ideas in her business and until now everything has gone very well. Also, because her community is outside of the city, the townspeople have many necessities, and this contributes to the success of Judith’s business as thanks to a good road, she is able to transport her products from the city to her town. Now, she needs to invest in new merchandise. For this she needs your help and is asking for a loan, money that she would invest in the purchase of new products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with a new variety of products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Junto a su esposo, desde hace15 años, viene dedicándose arduamente, en lo que es para ellos un esfuerzo familiar, su propia fábrica de ladrillos, en un inicio, solo ellos trabajaban todo el día en fabricación de los ladrillos, desde obtener la materia prima, mezclar los materiales, amasar y moldear la mezcla, caldear el horno, para luego hacerlos cocer cerca de 3 días, ahora, con el crecimiento gradual de su negocio familiar, tienen la posibilidad de contratar peones para esta labor, aunque de todas maneras Maria y su esposo siguen dedicándose a esta labor, debido al aumento de pedidos de ladrillos, que son vendidos por millares y en las ferias de construcción.  Maria trabaja de esta manera para sustentar la economía de su hogar y los gastos de estudios de sus hijos. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar leña para su horno de ladrillos y también para el pago de jornal de los peones que contratará.
texts.en:
Maria, 39, lives with her husband and 3 children. Fifteen years ago, with their usual dedication, they began their own brick manufacture. In the beginning, they worked all alone making the bricks, gathering the materials, mixing, molding the mixture, heating the kiln, and finally baking the bricks for 3 days. Now, with the gradual growth of their family business, they have the opportunity to hire laborers for this work, although in any case Maria and her husband will continue giving themselves to their business, thanks to the increasing orders for bricks, that are sold by the thousands and in construction markets. Maria works like this to support the expenses of the household and her children's education. She is requesting this loan so she can purchase firewood for her brick kiln and also to pay her day laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood for her brick kiln.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 33-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Jihad has owned a grocery shop for 10 years. He sells grocery products and candies. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his grocery shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on schedule.

When he first opened his shop, he had some savings that had helped him and he had his father's financial support to buy merchandise. Now, he plans to expand his business and diversify his merchandise in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: Jihad needs the loan to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
El g/s ROSA BLANCA  son del domicilio de Campuzano comarca de Nindiri este barrio queda a 2 km de la sucursal, sus integrantes son de origen campesino, por tal motivo son tímidas y de poco hablar, se siente satisfecha de trabajar con adim ya que además del crédito las ha capacitado en la administración de su negocios y  se han dado cuenta  lo útil que son para la sociedad.
Doña Maria empezó con un capital menor de C$1,000.00, con los créditos de adim ella los ha invertido en capital de trabajo y este ha crecido, lo que le ha generado mas ganancias, en la actualidad manejan montos mayores a C$3,100.00
Doña Mercedes tiene negocio de destace de cerdo ella destaza 2 veces a la semana, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos en la comercialización de productos,  su  familia es pequeña.  Piensa en un futuro tener su propia crianza de cerdos para obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de adim en cuanto a mantener su crédito.
texts.en:
The g/s ROSA BLANCA (White Rose) is from the Campuzano region of Nindiri. This neighborhood is 2 km from the office. Its members are peasants and therefore are shy and speak very little. They are happy to work with ADIM since, in addition to loans, ADIM has given them skills to manage their businesses and they now realize that they are useful to society.

Doña Maria began with less than C$1,000.00 in capital. With loans from ADIM, she has invested in working capital and this has grown, which has generated more profits. She now manages amounts over C$3,100.00.

Doña Mercedes slaughters pigs twice a week and counts on the help of her husband and children to sell her products. Her family is small. She thinks of raising pigs in the future to earn greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. She knows that she is going to achieve this with the help of ADIM to maintain her loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sron

texts.en: Mrs. C., 24, has a motorcycle washing service as well as a business selling groceries in her village of Korkthlok in Siem Reap Province. She has been running the business since 2007 and earns around KHR 5000 ($1.25) per day. Her husband is 27 years old and works repairing motorcycle at the same place. C. and her husband's business has gone well. She cares for two children, all of whom are small teenagers and in school. To increase their income, C. would like to ask for a loan for her husband's business to purchase more repair materials. She said the loan will help to increase her family's income.

loans.use: purchase more repair materials

loans.name: Neema A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Pictured here is 50 year-old Neema S. from Mbeya. She is married with seven children who are between the ages of 13 and 30. 

Neema has been running a mgahawa business [local restaurant] since 2008. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to visit. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantains (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 13 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Neema currently earns about 96USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300USD in order to renovate a her business place. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida lives in the village of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela.  She is 49 years old and married to Leonard.  Their three children are Ereneo - 26 years old and studying in his third year college, Gilbert - 20 years old who has finished his first year high school and is now a construction worker, and Leonardo D. Jr. - 12 years old and studying in his 1st year of high school in the nearby public school. 

Leonida has a passenger motorcycle business in their village; it is operated daily by her husband.  The money that they earn is used to finance their children’s education and their family's daily needs including monthly bills of electricity and water.  

Their motorcycle transport business is being amortized monthly; thus, their income from its daily operation is just enough.  

Leonida is looking forward to her request for a loan of PHP5, 000 being granted so they will have money to use for motorcycle maintenance since, at the moment, it always malfunctions due to its needs for some spare parts and repair.  

Their motorcycle transport is their only means of satisfying their family's needs; thus, Leonida prays for the financial support to their business.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom V. is a local fisherman, aged 48. He relies on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake and the public pounds in the village. He normally uses net tools for fishing. He can generate an average revenue of $4 per day to help be responsible for his family’s foods needs. Besides this he also cultivates a rice crop.

His wife's name is Thon, 44. She sells the fish she gets from her husband's fishing in the market. The family has five children: four are single and one is married and lives away from the family home.

Prom V. is asking for a loan to buy more fishing tools for his business operations. They live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Мuхаbbат

texts.ru: Мухаббат молодая женщина, 38 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Не имеет постоянной работы и посоветовавшись с мужем она решила заняться предпринимательством. Рассчитав различные виды бизнеса остановилась на продаже продуктов питания. Если даже все виды бизнеса имеют некоторый упадок в связи с экономическим кризисом, продукты питания все равно приносят прибыль. Мухаббат арендует прилавок в  2 метра и ассортимент товаров включает в себя различные виды макарон, чая, конфет, сахар и тп. У Мухаббат дружелюбная улыбка и поэтому у ее прилавка постоянно людно. Мухаббат и МикроИнвест сотрудничают уже больше года. Недавно Мухаббат подала заявку на новый займ и хочет приобрести оптом макароны и сахар.
texts.en:
Muxabbat is a young woman, 38 years old, married and has two children. She does not have regular employment, and after talking it over with her husband, decided to open a business. After considering various kinds of business, she settled on selling groceries. Despite the fact that all sorts of businesses have hit a low in the economic crisis, food still makes a profit. Muxabbat rents a 2-meter stall and her inventory includes various kinds of pasta, tea, candy, sugar and such. She has a friendly smile and because of it her stall is constantly busy. Muxabbat and MicroInvest have collaborated for several years. Recently Muxabbat applied for a new loan and she wants to purchase pasta and sugar in bulk.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bulk purchase of pasta and sugar

loans.name: Jesús Del Pilar

texts.es:
JESUS DEL PILAR H. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” vive en la Av. Santa clara Mz.A Lt.a, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 27 años de edad y 1 hijo.  Su pareja es afilador (servicio).

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró gaseosas para vender.

Hoy en día, ella es quien trabaja para apoyar a  su familia.  Paralelamente está invirtiendo en la venta de curichis (Chupetes hecho de aguaje), este negocio es rentable dado que a mucha gente les gusta este producto.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para elaborar estos curichis  para vender.

“Soy una mujer muy feliz que me siento realizada, aunque no tengo estudios superiores veo que cuando uno quiere salir adelante lo puede hacer y esto es lo que me dijeron en Manuela Ramos”.
texts.en:
JESUS DEL PILAR H. T. is a member of the “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” (Productive Women) Microfinance Institute. She lives on Santa Clara Avenue in the city of Pucallpa. She is a 27-year-old mother with 1 son. Her partner is an itinerant knife sharpener, providing knife sharpening services.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased soft drinks to sell.

Today, she is the one who is working to support her family. She is also investing her money in selling curichis (frozen Moriche palm fruit bars). This business is profitable because many people like this product. With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase the supplies she needs to make curichis and sell them.

“I am a very happy woman because I feel fulfilled. Even though I do not have a degree, I see that when one wants to get ahead, one can do it, and this is what they told me at Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and supplies needed to make frozen fruit bars

loans.name: Mame Ramata

texts.fr: MAME RAMATA D. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.DISPOSANT D'UN FRIGO ELLE VEND DE LA GLACE ET DU JUS.CE CREDIT LUI PERMETTRA DE RENFORCER SON DE MATIERE PREMIERE.ELLE CAPITALISE SIX ANNEES D'EXPERIENCE.
texts.en:
MAME RAMATA D. has been a recipient parent for several years and has a refrigerator. She sells ice and juices. This loan will enable her to bolster her inventory of basic ingredients. She capitalizes on her six years of experience.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is 61 years old this year. She is a widow and has four married children. She has had a farm since 1964. At present, she still manages to farm with the help of her laborers. Based on past experience, she will earned 20,000 PHP to 30,000 PHP every harvest.
