She needs additional capital to run her business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities.
CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Jubrim

texts.en: Jubrim sells weavon, hair extensions and jewellery in her house. Jubrim is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more weavon, hair extensions and jewellery to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase weavon, hair extensions and jewellery

loans.name: Ni Wayan Dewi Artati

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Dewi Artati - (DNR.M-0581) is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Palasari - Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Wayan Dewi Artati owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Wayan Dewi Artati has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 350,000 Indonesian rupiahs (about $34 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Wayan Dewi Artati joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Wayan Dewi Artati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 rupiahs from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 rupiahs which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the second loan she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Wayan Dewi Artati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Wayan Dewi Artati - (DNR.M-0581) merupakan 34 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Palasari - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Dewi Artati memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Wayan Dewi Artati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Dewi Artati menghasilkan sekitar 350,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Wayan Dewi Artati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Wayan Dewi Artati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli ternak indukan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Dewi Artati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pork

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a 52-year-old businesswoman. She has food vending, crop production, and rice retailing businesses. She sends all of her three children to school out of the profit her businesses are making and also through the support of her farmer husband. From a loan she had when she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2000, she was able to start her food vending business. After several loans, she ventured into the crop production business. With her most recent loan, Nenita started a new business, which is rice retailing. With this business she had bigger profit thus, she thought of asking for a larger loan from ASHI to finance her plan of growing it. She wants to increase the volume of rice she sells and build a storage room for it. Someday, she wishes to become a wholesaler of rice in her village.

Since Nenita became a member of ASHI, her performances in terms of repayment, attendance during ASHI weekly center meetings, and in her businesses are excellent. This allows her to avail herself other types of loans from ASHI such as educational loans and house repair loans aside from those that are only meant for business. 

With the loans she has from ASHI, Nenita wishes that someday all of her children will graduate from college and will have their own careers.

loans.use: To buy rice and materials for a storage room

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a thirty three year old father of three school going children. He runs a bodaboda (motorbike taxi) business in Nairobi; he also operates a bicycle repair garage in Kyangombe village as well as a retail kiosk that his wife operates. He has requested for a fourth loan of Kes. 80,000 after successful repayment of three other loans in order to buy a motorbike and add stock of bicycle spares. He hopes to grow his bodaboda business into a cab company, the kiosk into a wholesale shop and the spares business into sale of bicycles. He describes himself as social, peaceful and God fearing.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Bath Morie United Group

texts.en:
AL-Hassan S. B., on the left, is the leader of this group. AL-Hassan sells used clothes and has been in the business for three years now. AL-Hassan will top-up the loan to get himself a bale of secondhand clothes. He is approximately age 55, married, with five children. Two of AL-Hassan’s children are already married, two are young and one is in secondary school. He was born in Matokoka village which is about five miles from Magburaka town.

These are members of the Bath Morie United group. They are petty traders in Magburaka town, in Northern Sierra Leone. For the first time, these people are seeking a loan in order to boost their businesses. With a loan of Le 500,000 each, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that sales and profit will improve. Consequently, they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny vive en el Pasaje Maria Auxiliadora de la zona Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz
 
El señor vive en alquiler junto a su familia, trabaja con su propia movilidad, su esposa se dedica a la confección de ropa para muñecas de navidad.

El préstamo que solicita será utilizado en la compra de materiales, telas, encajes, para la confección de su producto.

loans.use: compra de telas, encajes y otros insumos para el negocio de confección de ropa de muñecas para navidad que tiene su esposa.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 28 years old and is married with three children aged between 8 months and 5 years. He lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where he has had a shop since 1999. He employs one person in his shop, which is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Innocent is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing a greater variety of goods for sale.

By receiving and using this loan, Innocent hopes to improve his offerings to his customers and attract additional customers. If he is successful, the increased profits will help him to pay school fees and provide more, and better, food for his children. In addition, he hopes to help his community by bringing more high quality goods closer to them at the cheapest prices he is able to provide.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Martha Belgica

texts.en:
Martha Belgica S. V. is 25 years old and lives in the Fortin district of Guayaquil. Fortin is a semi-urban, marginalized zone without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system. Ms. S. lives in a fragile wood and cane home situated on a steep incline.  In order to support herself and her son, Ms. S. sells Yanbal products.  Yanbal is a popular Latin American cosmetics company, which allows women to be direct sellers of their beauty products.  Originally, Ms. S. was paid a "finder's fee" by a friend who sold Yanbal products, but about 1 year ago she decided to become a full-time sales person.  Ms. S. has built a base of approximately 20 fixed clients throughout Guayaquil, and she travels to their homes with perfumes and colognes. 

Ms. S. is requesting a loan to purchase more Yanbal products.  She needs the loan because she offers her clients a “lay away” plan and it often takes them  a couple of months to pay the full price of the products (its costs $26 for perfume and $40 for cologne).  In the future, Ms. S. wishes to secure her cane home with cement. Hopefully, an increase in sales will help her achieve this.  She is grateful for any support we can provide her business, so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: To buy perfume and cologne to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa L. is from the village of P-4 Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Narcisa is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Narcisa sells fish to the local community. Narcisa has running her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Narcisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Narcisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: El Señor De Chalma Group

texts.es:
El grupo El señor de Chalma esta integrado por 11 clientes de la comunidad de Sn. Miguel Tlacamama se encuentra ubicado a escasos 10 kms. de Pinotepa Nacional, todos son comerciantes, muchas personas en la region se dedican a la venta de quesos frescos como es el caso de Isidora Alberta C. que vende queso fresco desde hace cinco años, sus hermanos le proporcionaban el producto ya que ellos son los que cuentan con ganado vacuno y ellos mismos lo elaboran, a ella le daban un porcentaje de la ganancia obtenida cada vez que salia a vender, ahora con el dinero del credito comenta que va a comprar el producto a sus hermanos y que de ese modo iniciará su pequeño negocio ya que el producto se vende muy bien en la región y se considera que es un producto de primera necesidad y el precio no es muy alto, con sus utilidades que obtenga seguirá inviertiendo en su negocio de venta de quesos y continuará con la compra  de puercos para engordarlos y venderlos en pie que es una de las actividades que ha realizado tambien ya desde hace 8 años aproximadamente.
considera que es parte de su responsabilidad la recuperación del credito ya que de ello depende que continue recibiendo el beneficio que la Fundación le ofrece y que de ese modo podra ayudar con los gastos a su esposo que es campesino y asus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años.
El resto de los integrantes del grupo son comerciantes tambien, el dinero del credito lo utilizán para comprar y vender verduras,abarrotes, quesos frescos,ropa para dama, comprar igredientes para preparar tacos blandos, refrescos,tamales de carne de puerco y pagar el transporte al lugar de donde adquieren la mercancia y los ingredientes ya sea en la cd. de Acapulgo Guerrero ó Pinotepa Nacional, como es el caso de la sra Maria Apolinaria R. compra chiles verdes y pescado seco en el mercado de pinotepa y revende en pueblos circunvecinos de tlacamama ella nos comenta que es quien mantiene a su  esposo ya que padece de una enfermedad en los pies que no le permite trabajar y como no recibe el apoyo de ninguno de sus hijos ella es quien desde hace cinco años es la que lleva el sustento de su familia y que espera que Dios le ayude dijo para continuar pagando bien y seguir recibiendo el credito que le ofrece la Fundación como lo ha hecho desde hace ya dos años y medio.
Todas las personas del grupo tienen como principal objetivo contribuir economicamente a sus familias con las ganancias que obtienen del trabajo que ellas realizán día con día y mejorar así su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The "El Señor de Chalma" group is made up of 11 clients in the Sn. Miguel Tlacamama community, located about 10 kilometers from Pinotepa Nacional. They are all merchants. Many people in the region sell fresh cheeses, which is the case for Isidora Alberta C., who has sold them for five years. Her siblings split up the profits, since they are the ones who own the cows and make the product themselves. They give her a percentage of the profits when she goes to sell. Now, with the loan money, she will buy the product from her siblings and start her own small business. The product sells very well in the region and is considered an inexpensive basic necessity. With the supplies she obtains, she will keep investing in her cheese-selling business and continue purchasing pigs to fatten and sell them. She has done this activity for about eight years. She considers it part of her responsibility to recuperate the loan because the group depends on continuing to receive the benefits of the foundation. She will be able to help her husband, a peasant farmer, with the expenses, and also help her children, who are eight and ten years old. The rest of the group members are also merchants. They will use the loan money to buy and sell vegetables, groceries, fresh cheeses, and women's clothing; buy ingredients for tacos, beverages, and pork tamales; and pay to transport merchandise and ingredients to the cities of Acapulgo Guerrero and Pinotepa Nacional. Maria Apolinaria R. buys green chiles and dried fish in the Pinotepa market and resells them in villages near Tlacamama. She says that she takes care of her husband, who has a leg disease that does not allow him to work. Since they do not receive support from any of their children, it is she who has supported her family for five years. She hopes that God will help her continue to make her payments and keep receiving credit from the foundation, as she has been doing for the past two and a half years. All of the group members' principal objective is to contribute economically to their families with their day-to-day earnings, and thus improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and make products to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Comfort is a petty trader. She sells second-hand footwear. Comfort hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for six years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She therefore wants the loan to procure goods in bulk to be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy used footwear for resale

loans.name: Tumurchudur

texts.en: B. Tumurchudur operates a business making wood products in his town with the help of his wife. He is 26 years old and lives with his wife and baby daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family are temporarily living in a house that has been provided by his sister. Tumurchudur started his business in 2002 with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 US) after being trained in his craft. Over the years, Tumurchudur has worked hard to expand and improve his business. His earnings have enabled him to build a workshop and purchase woodworking tools and equipment. Today his working capital exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~$560 US). Tumurchudur is a hardworking man with good communication skills. He says, "My main goal is to deliver quality product to my customers." He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood to fill current orders.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wood

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El señor Abraham tiene 42 años de edad, desde joven logro formar su familia el cual su esposa procreo tres hijos, su trabajo es la venta de especies de manzanilla y canela al por mayor el cual lleva siete años en las ventas, el trabajaba antes en el mismo oficio  de especies pero renuncio el cual puso su pequeña venta y poco a poco fue captando clientes  lo cual se vende mucho por ser medicinales, por ser buenas y de bajo costo. Sus ventas han estado bajas en las últimas semanas, como todo ha incrementado las ventas bajaron, todo esto se debe a la crisis que el país esta pasando poco, empleo y mal pagados. Su necesidad es poder cerrar bien su terreno ya que poco a poco ha venido haciendo el muro por toda su propiedad. Pero a un le falta es por eso comprara el resto de materiales  para terminar el muro ya que el aun tiene material es por eso solo  comprara: cemento, arena, piedrin y pagar la mano de obra para terminar su muro y estar con mejor seguridad de la delincuencia que asecha el barrio. Estos créditos han sido solo para mejorar su vivienda con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar su pequeña y humilde casa. Para el es importante cerrar todo su terreno para luego continuar mejorando su casa.  El cual esta contento por poder lograr sus objetivos, gracias al financiamiento de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Sr. Abraham is 42 years old. He and his wife started their family at a young age and now they have three children. Abraham has been selling chamomile and cinnamon wholesale for the past seven years. He previously sold these products before, but he gave it up when he attracted more customers selling medicine, which he was able to acquire at low cost and generate good sales. Within the past few weeks, his sales have gone down. Prices have increased on everything as a result of the financial crisis the country is experiencing. There are few jobs and workers are underpaid.

Abraham wants to enclose his land, so he started building a wall around his property. However, he lacks the remaining materials to finish the wall. He needs to buy cement, sand, and gravel and also pay for labor. A completed wall will provide better security against the crime that is plaguing the neighborhood. His previous loans have been the only means in which Abraham has been able to make improvements to his small modest home. It is important to enclose his land so that he can continue making improvements to his house at a later time. He is happy that he is able to achieve his objectives, thanks to the financing provided by AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building a wall

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1976, A. Elisabeth vit depuis 20 ans à Xwlacodji, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Mariée à METONOU Ludovic, un pêcheur,  Elisabeth est mère de 4 enfants dont certains parmi eux sont scolarisés. Elisabeth vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Elisabeth exerce comme activité principale la vente de banane plantains, comme autre activité, Elisabeth vend du savon, des tubercules de manioc et d’igname. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN et au GHANA, pays voisin du BENIN que Elisabeth s’approvisionne. Elisabeth vend ses produits de façon ambulante et par distribution. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 3ans. Elisabeth est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu 3crédits, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursé. Dans le souci d’augmenter son niveau d’activité et de diversifier ses produits, Elisabeth sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born 1976, A. Elisabeth has been living for twenty years in Xwlacodji, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to METONOU Ludovic, a fisherman, she is the mother of four children; some of them children are in school.  Elisabeth lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered.  To help out her husband, Elisabeth has a business selling plantains.  Her other business is selling soap, cassava tubers, and yams.  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Ghana, a country near Benin.  She sells her products door-to-door and by distribution. She didn't attend school but has been doing this work for three years.  Elisabeth is a loyal client of ALIDé who has already obtained three loans, which have all been repaid.  Concerned about increasing her level of business and diversifying her goods, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cassava and yam tubers, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Ngoeum

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 41 years old and currently resides in a rural area of Siem Reap, a province of Cambodia. Many years ago, she inherited a piece of land from her grandmother, which is located near her house. On her land, she cultivates different kinds of crops to earn a living. Because of her business, she has the capacity to buy food and pay for her children's school fees. She has a partner in her husband, who helps her in growing crops. S.'s farmland is located away from the watering system, so she always has difficulty irrigating her crop. Because of this problem, S. is looking for a loan to buy a pump to pump the water for her crops. The family has five school-aged kids.

loans.use: To buy a pump to pump the water for her crops.

loans.name: Shamela Grace

texts.en:
Shamela, 29 years old, is a married woman with three children. She lives in a town in South Cotabato with her family.

Shamela currently owns 2.5 hectares (6.25 acres) of rice field which she and her husband till together. She helps him ensure the rice crops are growing healthy on their land.

Shamela also joined CEVI to gain access to its programs. She asked for a loan of Php 8,000 which she will use to acquire seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Rosalio, tiene 46 años, es natural de la ciudad de Yucay y pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES” de la Asociación Arariwa, él socio tiene un hijo llamado Juan Carlos que tiene 14 años.  

Rosalio es un padre trabajador y responsable y que se dedica a transportar productos de las Ciudades de Urubamba a Cusco y viceversa, él nos cuenta que los días martes, jueves y sábado su actividad comercial empieza, cuando a las 9 de la noche la dueña de la mercadería hace cargar sus verduras. El socio sale de la ciudad de Urubamba  a las 10  de la noche y llega a la ciudad del Cusco a las 11 de la noche, él socio hace descarga los productos hasta las 2 o 3 de la madrugada y después él socio se va a dormir. El socia regresa al día siguiente a la ciudad de Urubamba llevando comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El anhelo del socio es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Yucay y un camión, él para lograr sus sueños esta ahorrando.

El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y fideos. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosalio is 46 years old, is a native of the city of Yucay and belongs to the community bank Reyna de los Angeles of the Arariwa Association. He has a son called Juan Carlos who is 14 years old. Rosalio is a hard working and responsible father who works transporting goods from the city of Urubamba to Cusco and vice versa. He tells us that on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays his commercial activity begins when at 9pm the owner of the shop loads her vegetables. He leaves the city of Urubamba at 10pm and arrives in Cusco at 11pm. He unloads the merchandise until 2 or 3 am, and after that he sleeps. He returns the following day to the city of Urubamba carrying groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. He wishes to buy a house in the city of Yucay and a truck. To achieve his dreams he is saving. This member needs the loan to buy groceries for example rice, sugar and noodles. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Alina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Alina Isabel S. V. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega desempeña el cargo de Secretaria es madre soltera de dos hijos  en edad escolar vive en el reparto Corazón de Jesús y vive junto con sus padres.

La señora Alina S. lleva ya  cuatro años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Alina works as a secretary at the Chinandega city hall. She is a single mother with two school-aged children. She lives with her parents in the Corazón de Jesús area. Alina has been working with CEPRODEL for four years and she has proven herself to be very responsible with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice candy, candies and snack food in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Gloria joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Fátima

texts.en:
Mrs. Fátima G. A. was born in the city of Carapeguá and lives there now with her mother. She is dedicated to her business, selling clothes.
Having a good quantity of clients has helped her to increase her income and thanks to this she has now been able to work toward her aspiration of building a house.

She has received a loan from our institution that she has used for the construction of her house and this loan that she is now requesting will also go towards finishing the construction.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cements, wood and other products for building of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of frozen foods for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45 year old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and three young children. In 2003, he opened his own café after working in the field for 3 years.

He is now requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an LCD projector for the cafe in order to attract more clients with the World Cup season.

loans.use: To purchase an LCD projector.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Mrs. Saret S. is a 29 year-old married woman who lives in Spueu village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and works very hard to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sary Toem, is a police officer and also a cow middleman, who makes a small profit to help his family. In order to support her farm and her husband's business, Mrs. Saret Some decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen for her rice farm and to buy a cow. The couple has two children too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy two oxen and a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en:
Gombo A. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province, western Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. The elder son is a student, while the other children attend a local middle school.

Gombo began his business in 2000 with the help of his wife. They sew a variety of shoes and clothing including deels, traditional Mongolian garments, and other coats that are suitable for the spring and fall weather in Mongolia. Since managing their business successfully, Gombo and his wife have been able to afford their children's tuition fees.

Gombo also makes hay from two hectares (five acres) of land once a year and sells the hay in autumn. He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to use for cutting the hay.

loans.use: To cut hay

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 59 years old and lives in Boochi Borabu, Kisii town, Western Kenya. She is married with six children who are now between the ages of 16 and 32. Four of the children attend school. She is a member of Itibo Zero Grazing Self Help Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo.  

Esther has been operating her mixed farm for the last thirty years. Her farm produces tea leaves, maize, beans and bananas, which she sells at the local Kenya Tea Development Authority.  She also operates a kiosk as her other source of income.

Esther has requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the proceeds from the sale of milk she intends to pay her children’s school fees and increase her family’s nutritional intake by providing them with enough milk for consumption. In the future she hopes to increase the number of her dairy cows and expand her retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda H. (shown in the photo), 40, is a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of tH. are in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Chenda is a garment factory worker. She also rents space in her house to other garment factory workers. This works out well because her house is located near the garment factory. Chenda is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build additional rooms to rent and generate more income.

loans.use: To build additional rooms to rent.

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en:
Khin N. is a 39-year-old married woman and was selected as village bank president by the four members of the group loan, which is located in Svay Prey village, Kandal province. The members of this group will each use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 
     
Khin N. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land that she uses to cultivate rice on. She will use the funding from AMK to purchase fertilizer and to hire farming laborers to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Tharng Khan, who is 39 years old, works as foreman and builder and can earn a small income to support his family. This couple has two children: one is a government worker and another is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to hire farming laborers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida A., 38, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio A., a driver/mechanic, and mother to four children, three of whom are in high school while the youngest is currently in elementary. By the grace of God, Aida has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually send all of them all the way through college.

Aida oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) and tricycle transportation business. They have long (20-22 person capacity) and short (14-16 person capacity) jeepneys, all of which pay boundary (daily quota) each day. Aida’s husband also drives one of the jeepneys.
 
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and repair the tricycle and jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Aida dreams of being able to buy another jeepney soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

- Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair tricycle and jeepney.

loans.name: Jamilita

texts.en:
Jamilita M. is 43 years old, married and has six school-aged children. She is from the village of Maac, a part of the municipality of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Jamilita runs a retail store from which she primarily buys and sells fish like bangus, tamban, and bilong-bilong to the local community. Jamilita has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jamilita joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 4000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fish to sell and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell and for working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda F. is 47 years old, married, and lives in Antipolo, Rizal, in the Philippines with her husband and her two daughters, Cyrel and Nicole.  To supply additional income for her family, Yolanda is opening a business of buying and selling a variety of small goods in her neighborhood.

Yolanda would like to receive a loan amounting 10,000 PHP to support her venture.  She believes this loan will help her business attract more customers.  This is the first year of her membership in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines. Yolanda is grateful for the access to loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long term goals are to have a successful business, to have her own house, to fund the education of her siblings until they complete a degree and to support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI, Yolanda is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor.

loans.use: to support her buying and selling business

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem C., 53, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 1 each per day. Two of her children are employed at factories, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

C. has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 60 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is also a skillful weaver, so  C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase raw silk to produce more silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marisol; ella tiene 30 años y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de Courier (envió de encominedas,cartas,sobres entre otros),la socia lleva ya un par de años en este negocio, ella se encuentra feliz ya que mediante este negocio esta forjando su futuro.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su negocio y pagar algunos deudas pendientes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the “Mi Peru” (My Peru) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marisol is 30 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business as a courier (she delivers messages, letters and envelopes, amongst other things).  She has been in this business for a couple of years.  She is happy since through this business she is forging a future.

She is requesting this loan to improve her business and pay some outstanding debts.

He is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To improve her business and pay some outstanding debts

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
el señor Pedro Pablo R. tiene 68 años de edad, vive en la colonia 21 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica al destazo de ganado,  actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, distribuye su proucto a varias carnicerias de dicha ciudad.
Pedro lucha cada dia para para seguir creciendo como micro empresario y de esta manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, es bien responsable y honrado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro Pablo R. is 68 years old. He lives in the 21 de Diciembre neighbourhood of the city of Choluteca and works as a slaughterman, which he has been doing for many years. He sells his meat to various butchers across the city.

Every day Pedro succeeds in growing his small business a little more, and in this way he gives his wife a better quality of life. He is a most responsible and honourable man. The loan will be used for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock for slaughter

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María V. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la comunidad de San Capa que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

La Señora. María tiene 65 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, son todos mayores de edad,  casados y viven independientes. Vive en su casa propia acompañada de un nieto de 14 años que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.

Doña María labora en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y también se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y ganado. Vende la leche a los carros lecheros que pasan por el sector y todos sus animales los vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia es fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta porque tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de animales como son pollos, cerdos, etc. Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
María V. is a member of the "Nueva Amistad" (New Friendship) community bank.  She lives in San Capa community which is in Cumbe parish.  This parish is noted for its fields full of crops since its residents work in agriculture and livestock farming.  Many of its people find work in the city to help their household incomes.

María is 65 years old.  She is a single mother and has 5 grown-up children.  All of her children are married and live independently.  Maria lives in her own home with her 14 year-old grandson who studies at a school in the city.

Maria works as a farmer, growing vegetables.  She also raises chickens, guinea pigs and cattle.  She sells her cows' milk to the milk trucks that pass through her area and she sells all of her animals in her community.

Maria is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because she has some very good friends in the group.  She will invest her loan money in buying animals such as chickens, pigs, etc.  Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es:
Jorge Luís Z. M. tiene 25 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y a su hijo. En el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jorge Luís se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Jorge Luís Z. M. is 25, in a common-law marriage, and lives with his partner and child in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has one child.

The members of the V.R.C. Jesus Nos Ama ["Jesus Loves Us"] are located in the Los Amarillos district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this communal bank have long worked in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice.

Jorge Luis has worked in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and cocoa for five years. He buys his products in Agripac Eicopa, and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. Through supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. They confront challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to continue working.

He enjoys watching television.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Шапоатова Орифа проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 45 лет. Она разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Образование средне – специальное, товаровед. Работает на центральном рынке района. Она в основном занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Orifa Shopatova lives in the Vahdat region. She is 45 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She has specialized secondary education, she is a commodities expert. She works on the central market in the region. She mainly sells children's clothing. She has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to increase sales volume.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a pickup truck for lawn-service business

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma C. is from the village of Union Kalinga, Luna, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Norma is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Norma is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $69 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Del Norte. She is 46 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Diguihola's Group

texts.en:
Diguihola and Pascaline live in the same neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their sixth loan with ALIDE, and they support each other in business and in loan repayments.

Diguihola (with her hand raised in the photo) is 64 years old. She moved to her current neigborhood in Cotonou 18 years ago and now lives with her husband, Fachina. Their two children are now adults and have left their parents' care.

For the past 16 years, Diguihola has run a stall selling meals outside her home. This loan will enable her to purchase the raw ingredients she needs from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to strengthen her business. She claims to be very dynamic in her approach to business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, and cooking oil for food preparation

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor Manuel es un joven de 22 años que desde muy niño, buscaba la forma de generar ingresos, haciendo trabajos academicos; a los 12 impulsado por su espiritu emprendedor e independiente, empezò a trabajar como  ayudante en una panaderia haciendo los domicilios y cuando  en este negocio su propietario abrió otro  de comidas rápidas, se propuso a aprender; asì fue como al año siguiente, a los 13 de edad, ya sabia prepararlas y poco a poco creò el suyo propio hasta lograr comprar  implementos de trabajo,aunque aun no tiene un carro de perros propio, pero tiene una meta y es la de comprarlo, ya que le hace mucha falta y el que utiliza es alquilado; esta es la razòn por la cual recurre a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo para aplicar a su primer credikiva con el cual cumplira su meta. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios de Fìsica en la Universidad pues ya està en su sexto semestre, asi mismo tener un local propio donde pueda ofrecer un confortable servicio a sus clientes. Su mayor desafio ha sido el arrendamiento de un carro de perros que sea muy funcional porque el que maneja en la actualidad tiene un solo freidor y una plancha, el cual  le ofrece muy poco espacio de trabajo, de todas maneras dia a dia se esfuerza para aumentar su utilidad que es no menor del 55% y su credikiva comprarà su carro de perros.
texts.en: Victor Manuel is a young man who is 22 years old and since he was very young he looked for a way to generate an income by carrying out academic work. At the age of 12 years old, motivated by an enterprising spirit and independence, he started to work as an assistant in a neighborhood bakery. And when the owner opened another business selling fast foods he set out to learn the business. The following year, at the age of 13, he knew how to prepare foods and slowly he began to make a business of his own once he finally was able to purchase tools for his work. Even though he still does not have a cart of his own he has a personal goal of purchasing one. He really needs one especially because the one he uses is rented. This is the reason why he has approached Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) to apply for his first Kiva loan, through which he will reach his goal. His dream is to complete his university studies in Physics; he is already on his sixth semester. His greatest challenge has been to rent a food cart that is highly functional because the one he currently rents only has one fryer and one skillet, giving him very little space to work. But despite this he works day after day to increase his profits. They never fall below 55%. And his Kiva loan will be used to purchase a food cart.

loans.use: to purchase a hotdog cart

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de tarjetas, venta de chompas, venta de comida, venta de café, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de repuestos de autos, confección de prendas de vestir, confección de chamarras, confección de mantas.

La señora María, indica que hace diez años que trabaja con Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que aprendió de sus padres y de la escuela evangélica desde hace quince años, ganado muchos clientes. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento de mercadería (para la elaboración de comida), las que comprará en El Alto, en la 12 de octubre y lo venderá en su puesto fijo de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el préstamo rápido.
texts.en:
The “CLAVELES” (Carnations) community bank is about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional office.  The group has eight members and is managed by an executive committee which is led by María.  The businesses that the members are engaged in are varied and include: selling cards, selling sweaters, selling food, selling coffee, selling cleaning products, selling car parts, making clothes, making jackets and making blankets.

María tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for ten years.  She currently has a business selling food.  This is a business that she learned from her parents and her evangelical school.  She has been in this business for fifteen years and has a lot of customers.

María will use her loan to increase her merchandise (to prepare her food).  She will buy her merchandise in El Alto, in the 12 de Octubre neighborhood and will make her sales from her fixed sales location, from Monday to Friday.  This work allows María to make money to support her family.  She is married and has four children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings and the speed with which you can get a loan.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: Delmar

texts.en:
Delmar is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. He is 23 years old and married with one infant child. Delmar's spouse devotes herself full time to nursing their child.

He has been in the motorcycle transport services business for five years. Each month, Delmar earns approximately PHP 5,000. He is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000. He plans to use this loan to repair the trouble he has with an existing vehicle to ensure the safety of the passengers and to purchase accessories for better services.  

Delmar has been a client of ASKI for three years. In the future, he would like to diversify his business and earn additional money to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle and purchase other accessories

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar is from the village of Haritch in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He has a high school education and twelve years of experience as a private farmer.  Mkhitar is married with two sons (two and four years old).  Both Mkhitar and his wife want to save money for their children’s future education.  He would like a loan to purchase livestock and potato seeds.  With this investment, Mkhitar expects the family income to increase by fifteen percent.  In addition to supporting his family, Mkhitar also helps relatives with produce grown on the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and potato seeds

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 41 años, es separada y tiene 4 hijos. Irma se dedica a la confección de centros huamanguinos, fustanes, faldas, blusas etc. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, blondas, etc.
Desde niña le gustaba la confección y aprendió de una señora. La prendas que confecciona los vende entre sus caceras del mercado Carlos F. Vivanco y los días lunes los vende en la Feria de las Nazarenas. Está 3 años en FINCA Perú, ingreso por la invitación de su mamá, le gusta por la facilidad de los préstamos y le enseñaron a ahorrar, en las capacitaciones tocan temas muy bonitos como la familia, salud, presupuesto, negocio, les enseñan a trabajar y los valores, que los pone en práctica en su vida diaria. Con sus ahorros se compró otra maquina de coser y apoyo en una parte para que su hijo se comprara su mototaxi. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Palmeras cooperative bank.  She is 41 years old, separated, and has 4 children.  Irma dedicates herself to making clothing traditional to her region, slips, skirts, blouses, etc.  She will invest the loan she is requesting into buying fabrics, threads, laces, etc.  She has enjoyed sewing since she was a young girl, having learned the trade from a woman.

She sells the clothing she makes from her stall at the Carlos F. Vivanco market, and on Mondays she sells from the Nazarenas Market.  She has been with FINCA Perú for 3 years, having joined at her mother’s invitation.  She likes it because loans are facilitated and they showed her how to save.  In the trainings they touch on beautiful themes such as family, health, budgeting, business, about work and values, all of which she puts into practice in her daily life.

With her savings, she bought herself another sewing machine and contributed, in part, to her son’s purchase of a mototaxi.  Her dreams are for her business to continue to prosper and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and lace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil and cooking oil.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela socia del banco comunal Manos Maravillosas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos.
Son ocho años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un pequeño kiosco en una agencia de transportes, donde vende refrigerios, golosinas y bebidas heladas.
Habiendo quedado viuda y tener a cargo dos hijos que todavía están estudiando, ha tenido que ver la forma de trabajar para que no les falte nada.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 2,400.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 paquetes de frugos, 2 paquetes de agua, 3 tiras de papitas, 3 tiras de chizitos, 3 tiras de maní confitado, 2 cajas de galleta, 2 cientos de vasos descartables, 1 paquete de sorbete.
Este negocio debe estar bien surtido para que pueda tener más clientela, trabaja todo el día, solo por la noche regresa a casa para poder estar con sus hijos.
Está tranquila porque puede darle a sus hijos las cosas que necesitan, solo lamenta no poder estar más tiempo con ellos.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the communal bank "Manos Maravillosas", meaning "Marvelous Hands", of the district of Calleria in department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old, a widow, and she has two children. She has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for eight years. She has a small canteen at a sports center, selling frozen desserts, snacks, and cold drinks. Having been left a widow and having to take care of her two children who are still in school, she had to find a way to work so that they are not in need of anything. 

With her new loan of S/2,400 nuevos soles she will purchase: 3 packages of juice boxes, 2 packages of bottled water, 3 cases of potato chips, 3 cases of cheese twists, 3 cases of candied peanuts, 2 boxes of cookies, 200 disposable drinking cups, and 1 package of sorbet.

This business needs to be well stocked in order to attend more clients. She works all day and she only comes back at night to be with her children. She is content because she is able to provide her children with the things they need. She laments not being able to spend more time with them.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, juice boxes, and disposable drinking cups.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty-three year-old hardworking man with one child.  He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has owned an art and stationery shop for seven years.  He started with capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings. His challenge is bad debtors.  His vision is to set up an art gallery, and to own a residential house and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy stationery and T-shirts to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old. She takes care of six relatives.  Her business is well organized. She has three years of experience and she owns a secondhand clothing business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy various secondhand clothing to resell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, save for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various secondhand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Jariatu. She is married and has 4 children aged 17, 15, 11 and 2. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her - her younger brother.  In 2001, Jariatu established her cotton material business. She started her business because she had gained experience from her husband. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Jariatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans. She now requires a new loan to buy additional lace and dry cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Jariatu plans to educate her children, extend her business and to get a permanent house. 
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for material for her business

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru: On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Elnur 24 qoda. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenki i balki dlya parnika. On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom, ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i xorosho spravlyayetsya s ney.
texts.en: Elnur is married and has one child.  He is 24 years old.  He lives in the Baku region together with his wife and child.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN i order to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse.  He has been involved in agriculture for five years, loves his work and does well at it.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 59 years old, and married to Wambua Kitavi who is 60 years old. Together they have four children aged 18, 20, 26 and 27, who are all in business. Quarrying is her primary business--she has been in this business for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of 25,900 KES. She also has some rental houses. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client.

This is her first loan which she intends to use to purchase an extra quarry and build more rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase a piece of land to build more rental houses. Her dream is to become, through her hard work, the best quarry supplier in the whole Kitengela area.

loans.use: To purchase another quarry and also build more rental houses.

loans.name: Norita

texts.es:
La señora Norita es socia del banco comunal San Fernando del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 52 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. 6 hijos.
Está trabajando con Manuela Ramos desD. hace varios ciclos y se dedica a la venta D. productos nutricionales D. una marca muy conocida, tiene a su cargo la crianza y educación D. sus dos hijos menores.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 potes D. batidos, 2  frascos D. té, 1 crema, 2 frascos D. proteínas.
La venta D. estos productos le genera buenas ganancias y le permite hacer pedidos semanales, lo único que le faltaba para surtir su negocio era contar con una mayor inversión y ahora ya cuenta con el dinero que necesitaba.  Su hija le ayuda a vender sus productos, espera que más adelante pueda poner su propio club nutricional y pueda generar más ingresos a su hogar que bastante falta le hace.
Espera que Manuela Ramos siga brindando el apoyo necesario a todas las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Norita is a member of the San Fernando communal bank in Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 52 and a single mother of 6 children. She has been working with Manuela Ramos/CrediMujer through several loan cycles and she sells a very well known brand of nutritional products. She is raising and educating her two youngest children, who are minors and still dependent on her.

With her new loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy: 5 tins of milkshake, two bottles of tea, 1 of cream and 2 bottles of protein. The sale of these products generates good profits and allows her to place weekly orders. The only thing she needed to stock her business was a larger investment and now she has the money she needed. Her daughter helps her to sell her products. She hopes to be able to establish her own nutritional club later, thereby earning more income for her home, which lacks a great deal. 

She hopes that Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER continues to proviD. needed help to all working women.

loans.use: to buy milkshake, tea, cream

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Saumu dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of rice, sugar, and salt. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 22 years old.  He is married with 1 child.

Ronnie has a store involved in rice retailing. He has had this business for 2 years.  He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional rice to sell.

Ronnie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ronnie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for retail selling

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is 47 years old and her husband, Sihak is 36 years old (pictured together).  They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have three daughters who are in school.

Sophat and her husband are rice farmers and fishermen. Sophat is asking for her first loan of $800 to buy a boat and boat motor because she has a small boat and uses a boat paddle, which is why it’s difficult for her to move her boat from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy a boat and boat motor.

loans.name: Farilles

texts.es:
Farilles, de 27 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Vive con su pareja y su tres hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años de edad en su casa propia. Ella trabaja mucho para poder así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Farilles consiste en la venta de caldo, tiene un local en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad, esta cerca al puerto y cerca de algunas entidades desde donde van en busca de los deliciosos y sustanciosos caldos como solo ella sabe preparar. Lleva trabajando ya por tres meses y le esta yendo bien, trabaja sola en su venta, pero además ella tiene un negocio más que le significa un ingreso extra. Su conviviente maneja una mototaxi que compraron y con eso generan un ingresos adicional en su economía.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener tiempo disponible por las tardes y estar tranquila en su casa a lado de sus hijos, además siente que le va muy bien ya que generan doble ingreso en su hogar, espera mas adelante tener un negocio en su casa e iniciar con la venta de lubricantes. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado ella se compromete estar al dia en sus cuotas y así retribuir el gran apoyo que le brindarán. Se siente muy contenta en el grupo que pertenece ya que son muy amables con ella y sobre todo muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado, lo utilizará para arreglar la fachada y el interior de su local, además de comprar algunos ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Farilles is 27 years old and a good, nice, and very responsible woman. She lives with her partner and her three children, of 7, 4, and 2 years of age in her own home. She works a lot so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family. Her work consists of selling soup; she has a location in a very busy area of the city, and it is close to the port and also near other businesses where people go looking for the hearty and delicious soups that only she knows how to prepare. She has already been working in this business for 3 months and it is going well. She works alone but, along with her partner’s business, she is able to bring in extra income. Her partner runs a motorcycle taxi business that they bought and with that they generate extra income for their budget. She likes what she does now very much, since it allows her free time in the afternoons to relax at home and spend time with her family.  In addition, she feels that it is going well since they are earning a double income in their home; she hopes down the road to have a business in her home and to start with the sale of oil. This will be the second loan she has been given from the MFP institution. For that reason she is hoping for your help, in order to continue with her goals. In addition, she has promised to stay up to date with payments and thus repay the great support that she will receive. She feels very content with the MFP group, as they are very kind and supporting of her in her endeavors. With the money requested, she plans to use it to fix the facade and interior of her business and to buy some ingredients and supplies to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation, as well as materials for fixing the facade and interior of her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with six children. Five of her children are enrolled in school while one is married. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the family's basic needs. Christine owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Christine has operated a real estate business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the residents of the local area. She faces a major challenge of late rent payment from tenants. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSH 40,000 loan she wants to purchase building blocks, ceiling materials and pay for the services for her rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase building blocks, ceiling materials and pay for the services for her rental house.

loans.name: Meltu

texts.en:
Meltu is a 39-year-old man, married to Onci, a 30-year-old lady. They are blessed with five children namely: Veron, 13, in the 2nd grade of Senior High School; Angke, 10; Ariel, 8; Tiara, 6, (the three of them are at Primary School) and Aurelia, 3.

Meltu has been running a kiosk business for almost two years. He sells various household needs, such as food, snacks, cigarettes, bath soap, detergent, shampoo, and some cakes cooked by his wife. In addition to running a kiosk business, Meltu can also repair bicycles so sometimes he uses his skill to generate more income.

Meltu is planning to complete the business stock in his kiosk as demanded by the customers. In view of this opportunity, Meltu is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM to purchasr various items such as soft drinks, snacks, etc. Meltu is expecting that the loan applications will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase various items such as soft drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He has four children. Two years ago, he began a business as a poultry farmer. Dominic started off by keeping indigenous breeds and then ventured into high-grade animals. Dominic was introduced to Milango by his friends.

Dominic is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase chicks. He will use the extra income from his business to start farming fruit. His future ambition is to purchase a vehicle to transport his farm produce despite the challenge of price fluctuations.

loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is 37 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her two daughters, who are students. For over six years Syuzanna has been running her own business: clothing sales in a rented shop. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes and house slippers, which she buys weekly from Yerevan. 
Thanks to her business income Syuzanna keeps her family and pays for her children's education. This is Syuzanna’s seventh loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments. Her first Kiva loan Syuzanna used to buy spring season clothes to resell. Now Syuzanna is seeking a 400.000 AMD loan to buy winter sweaters and holiday blouses and dresses before New Year’s holiday.

loans.use: to buy winter sweaters and holiday blouse and dresses before New Year’s holiday

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 57 years and widowed, with five children. She has been in the farming business for the past six years, with a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Purity will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business for she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora María Auxiliadora, de la edad de 50 años, soltera tiene 3 hijos dos mayores de edad y una niña de 12 años, antes  trabajaba como modista en otro país pero como se puso peligroso el sitio donde vivía regreso a Nicaragua a trabajar en lo mismo pero no le fue muy bien y decidió poner su pulpería que la ha mantenido en todo este tiempo. Todos sus créditos los ha utilizado en la inversión de capital de trabajo, ahora con este préstamo numero 13 quiere comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas, carnes, productos lácteos entre potros, con esta inversión le ayudara a sus hijos para que ellos sigan adelante con sus estudios para su futuro.

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Ma. Elda

texts.en:
This is Ma. Elda and she's a vendor by trade at Intramuros City. She's been operating her sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years now. Handling a business that long, she has already experienced different circumstances that really tested her faith. But she remained tough, because this is her only means of income for assisting her three children who are with her.  

A sari-sari store is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite smaller than the usual, and offers only limited products which are commonly needed, such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Now she would like to humbly request a loan from you that would stock her store with an adequate quantity of grocery items to sell. All she wants is just to improve her sales to be able to earn. But that will not happen if her store is an empty display. She wants you to know that PHP 20,000 would be so much enough to help her family grow her business. 

Someday she dreams of expanding her inventory even more. She always wanted to have a better life and good health conditions for her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to stock her store with an adequate quantity of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en: My name is Jose M. and I own a candy counter called Chiclera Luisito.  My store sells candy, gum, chocolates, churros, and other sweets to the children of my neighborhood.  I have had my business for one year, and I work with my mother. She helps me sell my products. My clients are excellent, and my business is located in the center of the capital, Tegucigalpa. My goal is to grow my inventory to have a wider variety of products so that I can increase my sales and support my family.  With increased sales I will be able to purchase a new set of crutches so that I can walk better, and I will also be able to help my mother.
