Actualmente la Administración municipal reubicó todos los puntos D. venta en un espacio mucho más seguro puesto que anteriormente estaban ubicados en un sitio al aire libre y los negocios al igual que el D. Rosmira eran D. madera, plástico y cartón. 

El espacio asignado a Rosmira necesita D. algunas adecuaciones locativas para cumplir con su labor D. elaborar la comida casera que ofrece allí, por ello, necesita D. un préstamo pues no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacerlo.
texts.en:
For 28 years, Rosmira Elena Qunchía D. C. has developed her restaurant in the Mercados D. Girardota Square.  It has been a source of sustenance for her self and her family.  Even though she confirms that they do not all live at home, her business at least allows them to eat and covers their basic needs.

Currently, the municipal administration relocated all sales outlets into a more secure space.  Before, all businesses were out in open air.  Like Rosmira’s, the businesses operated out of stands maD. of wood, plastic and cardboard.

The space assigned to Rosmira calls for some upgrades, so that she can complete her work of making homemaD. food.  She needs a loan to do this, since she does not have the necessary capital.

loans.use: upgrade her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora Zamboanga del sur. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Fe  raisies crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Fe's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has  branches  offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: 40.thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Ha is 51 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Ha is the group leader of the 8.4.40.Thieu Toan solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Ha joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ha has been involved in this business for less than a year. The main hardship that Ha faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ha hopes to maintain  a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es: Senobia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, tiene 50 años, es casada con tres hijos. Se dedica a la venta de caldos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carnes, leña, leche, papas, leña, para la preparación de caldos. Senobia tiene un puesto de la venta de caldos en el Mercado Carlos F. Vivanco, actividad que lo realiza de lunes a domingo con la ayuda de su hija, aprendió de este negocio desde muy joven su mama se dedicaba a lo mismo. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad en los préstamos sin tantos papeleos y por los ahorros, con sus ahorros ayudo a la construcción de sus casa e implementar su cocina, se compró una congeladora. Su sueño es tener su recreo en su casa.
texts.en:
Senobia is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  She is 50 years old, married, and has three children.  Her business is selling soups.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying meat, milk, potatoes and firewood for preparing her soups.

Senobia has a sales stall in Carlos F. Vivanco market.  She works in her business from Monday to Sunday with the help of her daughter.  She learned the business when she was very young as her mom was in the same business.

Senobia likes FINCA Peru because the loans are easy to acquire, without the need for so much paperwork.  She also likes the savings.  Senobia's savings helped her to build her home and equip her kitchen.  She bought a freezer.  Her dream is to spend leisure time at home.

loans.use: to buy meat, milk, potatoes and firewood

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es una persona que se dedica a la venta de platillos caseros, y repostería, los  cuales vende  en las maquiladoras a todos los empleados  y de  esta  manera ella sostiene la casa, su alimentación y todos sus gastos personales,  además apoya a sus hijos que viven en otras ciudades, en este  momento ella  requiere invertir  en  la compra de ropa nueva para vender al publico  y de  esta manera  ayudarse económicamente y  que  mejor  que  realizando  lo  que  mas   le gusta   que   es  dedicarse  a  las  ventas ,  ya  que  ella  siempre  a sentido  cierta  atracción  en  el  ramo, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado por la  institución para  la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Señora Juana is a person who makes a living by selling homemade food and baked goods, which she sells at factories to all of the employees.  In this way, she supports her home by paying for food and personal expenses.  She also supports her children that live in other cities.  Right now, she needs to invest in the purchase of new clothing to sell to the public to help herself economically and to keep doing what she likes, which is sales.  She has always felt a certain attraction to this trade.  She is thankful for the support offered to her by the institution to carry out her project.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: G.s. Piedra Viva Group

texts.es: El Grupos Solidario Piedra Viva está compuesto por Néstor Javier tiene 42 años, su actividad económica es la venta de frutas. Este señor ha luchado todos los días por mejorar su condición de vida. En cambio Maria Del Carmen tiene 64 años y su actividad económica es crianza de cerdos, por lo que labora todos los fines de la semana. Ella aduce que sus hijos le apoyan. El financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
The 'Piedra Viva' solidarity group  has two members.

Néstor Javier is 42 years old.  His business is selling fruit.  This man has worked hard every day to improve his living conditions.

Maria del Carmen is 64 years old and her business is raising pigs.  She works every weekend.  She adds that her children support her in the business.  She will use this loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Mrs. Neak is from the Keussey Keo community in Phnom Penh City.  She sells items such as soft drinks, sweets, cooking supplies, cigarettes, snack foods, and cosmetic products in front of her home. To share in the responsibility and meet the family’s living expenses, her husband operates a motor taxi service and makes an average income of $4 a day.  This couple has four children, one is a sewing worker who works in factory. Mrs. Neak will be using this loan that she is applying for to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de son de riz (un aliment qui sert à nourrir les poules). Elle a 57ans et mariée à un agent à la retraite. Ce quatrième prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des sacs de son de riz à l’intérieur du pays et de revendre à ceux qui élèvent les poules. Elle a démarré en 2008.
texts.en: A seller of rice bran (used to feed chickens). She is 57 years old and married to a retired public servant. This loan is the fourth one she has requested. It will enable her to buy sacks of rice bran from the country's interior and to resell the goods to those who raise hens. She started off in 2008.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice bran

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Idriss.  He is married and has 2 children aged 2 and 1. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because she is his stepdaughter.

In 1995, Idriss established his school uniform and tailoring materials business. He began his business because he gained the experience of material sales through his elder brother and because uniform sales gives more profit. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Idriss has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional schooling materials. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Idriss plans to get a dwelling house and educate his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional used clothing for his business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future..

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and pay for transportation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS” iniciará su décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Maria Luisa es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de cajas, comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora María Luisa,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de cajas de tomate que viene trabajando hace cuatro años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus familias.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de la las barracas y posterior a la elaboración de lo entregará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Rosas” (The Roses) is starting its 11th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Maria Luisa serves as its treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different types of businesses to get ahead such as manufacturing crates, retail shops, production, and services.

Sra. Maria Luisa says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one year. She joined the organization after being invited by a local promoter. At the moment, she has a business that manufactures tomato crates. She has been involved in this type of work for four years and learned the trade from her relatives.

This loan will be used to increase her capital for purchasing wood. She acquires the wood from the lumber yards and manufactures her products according to order. Working this manner has enabled her to generate income to support her family. Maria Luisa is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria Luisa said that she enjoys the savings and the training classes.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making crates.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 65 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, por quienes trata de dar lo mejor. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida, negocio que lo ejecuta en el mercado central de su ciudad. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano, cuando se dirige a su local de venta, alista las mesas y sillas y luego se dispone a preparar los alimentos que expenderá durante el día. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en este trabajo y gracias a ella ha logrado cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Ella confiesa que le gusta cocinar, y eso lo demuestra, ya que son muchos los clientes que recurren a su establecimiento para consumir sus platillos. Además una de sus hijas la ayudan en la labor y juntas se han convertido en una gran equipo. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para arreglar las mesas y sillas que tiene, asimismo comprará materia prima para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Nora is 65 and a cheerful, hard-working woman.  She is a single mother and has five children for whom she tries to provide the best she can.  They live in their own house which she bought with much effort and sacrifice.  She has a food stall in the central market of her city.  Her work begins very early in the morning when she goes to her stall and sets up the tables and chairs.  Then she prepares the food that will be sold the rest of the day.  For 15 years she has been in business and, thanks to her work, has been able to cover educational expenses for her children.  

She admits that she enjoys cooking and the proof is that many customers visit her establishment to enjoy her dishes.  One of her daughters helps in the business and they have become a great team.  This is her third loan through MFP and she is counting on your help to continue with her activity.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials to repair the tables and chairs she already has, as well as to buy ingredients for the food she prepares.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and repair materials for tables and chairs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a grocery shop business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang, 37 years old, is a policeman and earns $3 per day. His wife is an animal seller and earns $3 per day. This couple has four children, three are studying and one is too young to go to school. Every month, he has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. He would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy more pigs to feed. Leang doesn’t want to do other things besides his current job and feeding pigs at home because he wants his wife staying home to take care of the children.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to feed

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. Philip has operated a retail shop for the past four months; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge in transporting his goods from the point of purchase to his place of business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this KES 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, soap and fuel for his shop. He decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it offers good financial services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, soap and fuel for his shop.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio Antonio es soltero, tiene 24 años de edad,  cursó los grados de secundaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operador para otro negocio, lleva hasta el momento 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de tejeduría consistentes en hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera en el futuro su negocio crezca y mejores sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Julio Antonio is 24 years old, single, and finished high school.  His business is weaving.  He started out in this line of work working as a laborer in another business.  He currently has five years experience.

Julio Antonio is requesting a loan to buy weaving materials (threads of different types and in different colors).  In the future he hopes that his business will grow and that he will improve his profits.

loans.use: to buy different colored threads

loans.name: Oñondivepa 2 Group

texts.es:
Oñondicepa 2 es un comité de la ciudad de Asunción, esta integrado por 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, quienes desean un mejor porvenir para sus hijos y familiares. Se encuentra en su 5 ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes, desean poder seguir dentro del programa de la fundación.
Una de ellas es la señora Eva, quien desde hace ya un tiempo se dedica a la venta de ropas, en lo cual ella se define que es muy buena, pues gracias a su simpatía y buena atención a los clientes y sumado a su buena calidad de ropas, ha logrado salir adelante. Quiere seguir con su microempresa, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, lo cual le servirá para abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Oñondivepa 2” is a committee from the city of Asunción that consists of 17 hardworking and enterprising women. They want a better future for their children and families. The group is in its fifth loan cycle, which highlights the sense of responsibility and the desire to progress from each of its members. They all want to continue in the program with Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Sra. Eva. She has been selling clothes for some time. Eva has done very well because of her friendliness, the good service she provides to her customers, and offering good quality clothes. As a result, she has been able to get ahead. Eva wants to continue her micro-enterprise, so she is requesting a loan to buy summer clothing in order to restock her inventory and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wood-working machine.

loans.name: Thecla

texts.en: Thecla is a 33-year-old single mother of a child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and she also operates a retail shop. Her challenge is the low pay at school and her family dream is to build a permanent house and educate her child. She dreams of setting up a wholesale shop to boost her income. Thecla needs the loan facility to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoeb is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She permanently lives in Takhmao town where she grows rice and vegetables with her husband. She is able to make around $4.00 per day. She describes herself as a low-educated woman. However she really loves and enjoys her farming business because it enables her to provide her children with a good education for the future. 
This is her second loan from HKL and she will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to ensure her crops grow well. She hopes that she will be able to generate a good output and earn extra income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Great variety and organized, attractive displays are important to attract shoppers attention at a busy market in Moldova.Responding to customers questions and quoting prices is also key and requires a quick and lively salesperson.Mariana is certainly that and has the experience and reputation gained from selling at the Calarasi outdoor market for 7 years now.She and her family also have a small store in her hometown of Horodiste, but most of the time she spends in the busier regional center, sometimes bringing her son along with her.She already carries many goods, but Marianna would like to purchase and sell some new products, including more tea and coffee as well as quickly prepared dried mixes and she needs a loan to pay for the initial purchases of such goods.She hopes her customers will welcome the new selection and buy eagerly!

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en: Dimitar B. has been in the agricultural business for more than 15 years. He and his family live in the village of Cherven, Smolian district, where his farm is. Dimitar breeds 19 cows and 7 calves. He also breeds two horses and has his own tractor. The animal fodder he needs he grows on his own land. Now Dimitar needs to change his old milking machine to a newer one and so he is asking for a loan of $1 200.

loans.use: To change his old milking machine to a newer one

loans.name: Antonia Carlota

texts.en:
Antonia is 17 years old and is single. She is in the third year of high school. She raises chickens and sells them to people in the community and also in the city market. This is how she finances her studies. She wants to buy more chickens and feed with the loan, and thereby increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ANTONIA TIENE 17 AÑOS ES SOLTERA Y CURSA EL TERCER AÑO DE NIVEL MEDIO SUPERIOR. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y LOS VENDE ENTRE LAS GENTES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y TAMBIEN EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD . CON ESTO ELLA LOGRA OBTENER DINERO PARA FINANCIARSE SUS ESTUDIOS. CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS AVES Y ALIMENTO Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO PALMAS 1

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.en:
Kunduz L. is 47 years old snd has secondary education. After graduation from school, she got married and has 5 children. She became a housewife and looked after her 5 children. After her children grew up, Kunduz decided to find a job. She was quite skilled at vegetable canning. This kind of product is in big demand in the local market.

In the market “Safariyon” in Dushanbe, Kunduz rented a stall where she could sell her canned vegetables. She sells her products both wholesale and retail and has been doing this type of business for 11 years.

With this loan of $1200, Kunduz is going to buy tomatoes, cabbages, and cucumbers for canning. This will allow her to increase the range of products she sells during the winter period when fresh vegetables are in short supply. In comparison with her competitors, Kunduz’s products have a low price, which gives city dwellers an opportunity to obtain canned products at reasonable prices. Kunduz plans to pay off the loan over a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages and cucumbers for canning

loans.name: Ni Ketut Derni

texts.id:
Ketut Derni bought 1 female pig and she takes care of it every morning and evening. In 6 months, the female pig has given birth to 8-10 piglets that can be sold. She earned Rp. 650,000 (about $71) from selling the piglets and then she bought another female pig so now she has 2 female pigs to breed. She has to spend Rp.20,000 (about $2) daily for feeding the pigs. She earns Rp.2,000,000 (about $218) from 2 female pigs per 6 months. This business has helped Ketut Derni pay her children education fee and renovate her house to become a more decent place to live in. She spends the loan for buying the the pig's food due to its increasing price.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Derni membeli 1ekor Penginduk yang dengan telaten dirawatnya setiap pagi dan sore hari, dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan babi induk ini mampu menghasilkan anak antara 8-10 anak babi yang nantinya akan dijual dan dari hasil penjualan anak babi ini Ketut Derni mendapat keuntungan Rp.650.000,- yang dipakai untuk membeli 1 ekor babi induk lagi sehingga sekarang Ketut Derni memelihara 2 ekor penginduk. Setiap hari biaya yang harus dikeluarkan Rp.20.000 hanya untuk pakan ternak saja. Dari 2 ekor penginduk yang dipelihara keuntungan yang diperoleh adalah sebesar Rp.2.000.000 setiap enam bulannya. Lewat usaha ini Ketut Derni bisa membiayai sekolah anaknya dan juga memperbaiki rumah tempat tinggalnya menjadi sebuah rumah yang layak ditempati. Pinjaman dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya karena semakin hari harga pakan semakin meningkat.

loans.use: To add growing pig, purchase female pig and pig's food

loans.name: Sokhem

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sokhem was married in 1980 and has 5 daughters. She started her grocery business in 1995. Her two daughters work at the garment factory, and her other three daughters study at the primary school in the village. Her husband runs a transportation service. He is currently transporting garment workers from their villages to the factory. Both Sokhem and her husband did not finish high school. However, they are working hard to help their children go to school.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her stock in order to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.es:
Maximiliana, Mónica and Felicitas are members of the Legion Community Bank since 5, 14 and 4 years respectively.

They all say that through the Community Bank they learned to be punctual, responsible and to be affectionate with their children.

Maximiliana, Mónica and Felicitas are all street vendors. Maximiliana creates textile handcrafts like rugs, blankets, and clothes that she sells at the market. Monica sells filled-potatoes that she cooks herself and Felicitas sells eggs at the Nery García Zarate market.

In the future, they would like their businesses to improve, they would like to sell in a safe place and have their own shop.

Therefore, they would like to borrow 400, 1600 and 400 soles respectively that they will invest buying more wool, eggs, oil and potatoes to profit from the Christmas’ sales increase.

Moreover, Monica would like to buy bread, chocolate and milk to sell at the city’s Christmas Market.

Maximiliana dreams to have capital to replenish her business. Mónica would like to own a restaurant of her own and Felicitas would like to later on buy a car that she will use for public transportation. They all dream to see their children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maximiliana, Mónica y Felicitas son socias del Banco Comunal Legión hace 5, 14 y 4 años respectivamente.

Ellas cuentan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y también a ser amorosas con sus hijos.

Felicitas venD. huevos ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García Zarate, mientras que Maximiliana realiza artesanía en textiles como pisos, frazadas, pasadizos y los venD. en el mercado. Mónica es ambulante y venD. papa rellena que ella misma prepara.

En el futuro ellas quieren que sus negocios mejoren, les gustaría vender en un lugar seguro y tener su propio local.

Sus préstamos son D. 400 soles, 1600 soles y 400 soles que serán invertidos en la compra D. huevos, menestras, curtiembres, lana procesada, aceite, papa, y por campaña D. navidad Mónica comprará panetones, chocolates y leche para venderlos en una feria naviD.ña D. la ciudad.

Los sueños D. Maximiliana, Mónica y Felicitas son comprar un carro para realizar transporte público, tener capital propio para surtir su negocio, tener un restaurante en un local adecuado y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Maximiliana, Mónica and Felicitas would like to borrow 400, 1600 and 400 soles respectively that they will invest buying wool, eggs, oil and potatoes to profit from the Christmas’ sales increase. Moreover, Monica would like to buy bread, chocolate and milk to sell at the city’s Christmas Market

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en: My name is Ayesha S.. I live with my family in Chichawatni, a small town in Pakistan. I am a mother of seven; three attend school while the elders could not get education due to our impoverished conditions in the past. My husband had to undergo few surgeries in the past and we had to spend a lot on him. Now he is fine and runs a grocery store.  I request a loan for his grocery store. He runs this store in a nearby busy market; at times I also help him at his store. I am a group leader of few other women and their families: Naseem B. plans a loan for their spices store, Farah B. requests a loan for their juice stall, Naheed B. would use a loan in their vegetable’s business, and Yasmeen B. would use a loan for her stitching business.

loans.use: To expand grocery store

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es:
” The floor in my home is made of cement and is difficult to keep clean. I would like to put tiled floor mostly for my children since it accumulates too much dust, and it is unhygienic for them. I have wanted to put it for a very long time, but in reality, there were other priorities also related to home improvement.” I am requesting $1,000.00 to put tiled floor in my home.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

““El piso de mi vivienda es de cemento y es difícil mantenerlo limpio, me gustaría poner vitropiso más que nada por mis hijos ya que se acumula mucha tierra y es antigénico para ellos desde hace mucho que he tenido la intención de ponerlo pero en realidad tenia otras prioridades también relacionadas con el mejoramiento de mi vivienda” Solicito  $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner vitropiso en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Install tiled floor in my home.

loans.name: Budumuli East A B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joan N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture like chairs and tables. Joan is 35 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 7 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Joan makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the house rent and school fees for her children. Joan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to buy more stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Joan is joined in her small group by Najabu N., Clare N., Margret K., and Beatrice K.. Najabu N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to buy more clothes and add stock. Clare N. is currently operating a business selling water and wants a loan to purchase another tank and machine. Margret K. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more charcoal in bulk. Beatrice K. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To add more restaurant equipment

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia T., 20, is married to a farmer.  She is entering the business of selling taro.  Both she and her husband will do the farming.  With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, 2 filings, seeds, pumpkins, and fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina works very hard everyday at the job that allows her to be a source of income for her household. She wants her 2 kids to be well looked after, and it is this desire that serves as constant motivation for her to keep on working and looking after her shop. Dina wants to keep progressing in business with her family and this is why she wants to open a small sewing workshop to make aprons too.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Dina, emprende a diario y con mucho esfuerzo un trabajo que le permite ser una fuente sostenedora de su hogar. Sus deseos de superación por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos la motivan constantemente para continuar con su trabajo de administrar su tienda.Dina quiere seguir progresando en compañía de su familia es por eso que también quiere implementar su pequeño taller de costura para confeccionar mandiles.

loans.use: To get a sewing workshop/Implementación de su taller de costura.

loans.name: Hadya

texts.en: Hadya is a 35-year-old mother of four. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Hadya sells clothes in her house. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sabes Group

texts.fr:
Within the context of fighting against poverty, under-employment and illegal emigration, SABES is an effective organization within several domains, such as business, fishing, agriculture, and processing fishing products. Every time there is a ceremony (baptisms, marriages, deaths) in Senegal, and particularly in Dakar, there is a need felt by the community to rent chairs and tarps in order to set up a place for their guests. The youth of SABES would like to take out a loan in order to buy chairs and tarps and offer a service to the community that sets up these locations. The goal is to fill the gap left by the effects of the economic difficulties on the main businesses.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, le sous-emploi et l'émigration clandestine, Sabes est une structure agissant dans plusieurs domaines tels que le commerce, la pêche, l'agriculture, transformation des produits halieutiques. Vu qu'au Sénégal particulièrement à Dakar, à chaque fois qu'il y a cérémonie (baptêmes, mariages, décès), nous sentons le besoin de la population à louer des chaises et bâches pour mettre en place leurs invités. C'est pourquoi nous jeunes de SABES, souhaitons avoir un financement pour offrir un service de proximité à la population en achetant des chaises et bâches et faire la location de ce matériel dans le but de combler le vide laissé par nos activités principales touchées par les difficultés conjoncturelles.

loans.use: Buy chairs and tarps for the locations

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
A. Suhrob lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 23 years old. He recently got married. He has no children. He lives with his parents, and is the sole bread-winner for the whole family. He works as a contract-based taxi driver. He has a "Tiko" car. The income isn't bad, but is enough just for day-to-day expenses. Now he wants to take out a loan to be able to pay for a wedding for his sister. He only needs $800 USD. He plans to take out this loan for ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Алиев Сухроб житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 23 года . Не так давно женился . Детей не имеет. Проживает вместе с родителями , поэтому он один обеспечивает всю семью. Работает частным таксистом. Имеет автомашину «Тико». Работа приносит не плохой доход , но его хватает на текущие расходы. Сейчас хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы провести свадьбу сестры. Ему не хватает всего 800 долларов США. Срок на который он планирует получить кредит 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Wedding.

loans.name: Wazaretou

texts.fr:
La cliente est née le 20 septembre 1965 à Ayengre dans la préfecture de Sotouboua, localité dans laquelle abondent les ignames. Elle est mariée et a 4 enfants. Depuis 2004, elle a commencé le commerce de vente ciment dans son quartier. La quantité de son stock attire beaucoup de clients et de cela elle tire beaucoup de revenus.

Actuellement compte tenu des échos de pénurie de ciments, elle souhaite en passer et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 3 tonnes de ciments.
texts.en:
The client was born on 20 Septembeer 1965 in Ayengre in the prefecture of Sotouboua, an area where yams grow in abundance. She is married and has 4 children. Since 2004, she has run a business selling cement in her district. The quantity of her stock attracts many customers, and she draws a large income from this. Currently, having taken note of talk about a shortage of cement, she hopes to ensure the survival of her business, and is asking for her first loan to buy 3 tonnes of cement.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three tons of cement

loans.name: Margueritte

texts.en:
Greetings from Marguerite in Kigali, Rwanda! Marguerite is 37 years old, married with two children and one adopted orphan.

Marguerite owns a small shop. She sells clothes and food stuffs, as well as needed household items like soap and candles. She employs one person to help her run the business.

She is applying for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to increase her inventory. This loan will be repaid in eight months.

loans.use: To Increase her inventory.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Mateo Acosta es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio San José, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. María de 29 años de edad, tienen casa propia, y 5 hijos, todos en edad escolar.

Trabaja como vendedor ambulante de artículos de mercerías y bijouterie, recorre por la ciudad y zonas aledañas, en una motocicleta para realizar su venta, tiene una clientela formada, buenos ingresos, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

El cliente sueña en comprar una camioneta para el reparto de sus mercaderías por la zona. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías varias para la venta como sábanas, manteles, ropas, zapatos, etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Mateo Acosta is from the city of San Estanislao, from the neighborhood of San José. He is 42 years old and is married to Mrs. María, who is 29. They own their home and have 5 children, all of whom are school aged. He works as a traveling salesman selling haberdashery and boutique items. He travels the city through residential areas on a motorcycle to make his sales. He has an established clientele, good income, and good personal and business references.

This client wishes to purchase a truck to deliver his products throughout the area. This loan will be used to purchase various items to sell such as sheets, table cloths, clothing, shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets, table cloths, clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 55 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos  mayores de edad. Se desempeña como agricultor, siembra naranjas en sus  hectáreas de terrenos  que posee desde hace 30 años. Siendo así, la agricultura una de sus pasiones, la  cosecha y selección  de las frutas es lo que más le gusta realizar, debido que puede saborear  el fruto de su trabajo, además las naranjas son frutas que en los mercados son muy solicitados, y  gracias a los comerciantes pueden  trasladarlos  hasta los diferentes mercados. Pero lo difícil de esta actividad es sembrar y cuidar sus plantas de naranjas, sobre todo cuidarlas de los insectos que perjudican sus  cultivos. Este es su cuarto préstamo, hasta hoy no ha tenido problemas en los días de pago. Alejandro adquirirá insecticidas y trampas para insectos, con las cuales podrá hacer frente a sus problemas con los insectos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55, is married, and has 3 adult children. He works as a farmer. He grows oranges in the land that he has owned for 30 years. Agriculture is one of his passions. Harvesting and selecting his fruit is what he likes to do most, since he can savor the fruit of his labor. Oranges also have a lot of demand in the markets, thanks to the merchants that transport them to the different markets. The difficult part of his work is planting and caring for his orange trees, and above all protecting them from insects that damage his crop. This is his fourth loan. He has not had problems with his repayments. Alejandro will acquire insecticides and insect traps, which will help him confront his problem with insects.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of insecticide and insect traps

loans.name: Jasmina Careli

texts.es: La Sr. Jasmina tiene 25 años de edad, habita del barrio 19 de Febrero, en la capital de Managua madre  soltera, tiene dos lindos hijos de 3 y 7 años de edad, sus planes para su familia brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y un patrimonio seguro ya que no tienen el apoyo de su padre, aunque con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante Doña Jasmina posee su pequeño negocio de ventas de cosméticos, joyas, ropa y otros, sus metas  en el ámbito económico es aumentar el volumen de venta con nuevas líneas de productos, lo inicio con crédito. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar nuevos producto para ofertarlos a sus clientes y comercializarlo a nuevos sectores del mercado
texts.en:
Senora Jasmina, 25, lives in the February 19th district in the capital of Managua. She is the single mother of two beautiful children, 3 and 7 years old. Her plans for her family are to provide a better future for her children and financial security since they do not receive support from their father. Although Doña Jasmina, through much effort, has gotten ahead in her small business selling cosmetics, jewelry, clothing and other things, her goal in the current economic climate is to increase the sales volume with new product lines, in the beginning on credit. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she has been able to buy new products to present to her clients and to sell in new sectors of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various jewelry and cosmetic products

loans.name: Mrs. Sinat Chou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of nine people, is located in Chumrov village in Takeo province and all the members will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Sinat C. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave in order to reach her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. Khon Kheng, is a farmer who owns 0.4-hecater to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mrs. Sinat C. is 40 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is four years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave in order to reach her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 25, lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ahmad has been working as a car painter for eight years. He is requesting a loan of $1200 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan; he repaid the first loan on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his family members, friends, and neighbors. Ahmad decided to paint cars because he wanted to work independently and improve his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Tto purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma Baji is a very determined lady and operates a clothes sewing business. With the income she was able to buy an electric sewing machine to grow her business.

She has been a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 2 years. Her husband's name is M. A. who has a motorbike rental business. Presently he has two bikes, which he rents per hour. Uzma Baji is applying for a loan to buy another bike to expand her husband’s motorbike rental business.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rent business

loans.name: Silaulelei

texts.en:
Silaulelei T., 75, is a widow with six children.  She has many years of experience in the pig farm business. Her loan will be used to buy cement, wires, timber, nails and iron roofing for building a proper shelter for her pig business. 

She sells six days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 166 Tala (about US$82).  SPBD loans are Silaulelei’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used only on the business.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails, iron roofing and more pigs

loans.name: Sae’D

texts.en: Sae’d A. is a young single man of 22 years of age. For two years, he has had a grocery store in Gaza City, Palestine. He would like to use this loan to increase trade by purchasing sacks of rice, canned goods, and other products for his shop. Doing so means he would be able to contribute to improving the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, canned goods, and other products for his shop.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milicent E. is trader who sells soft drinks in Elmina and she has been selling soft drinks since 1977.  Milicent has received training in college.  She is now a single parent with five dependents and she is responsible for paying school fees and bills.  Milicent will use the loan to buy more soft drinks for selling.  She hopes to save some of the additional profit that will result from the loan and also to purchase some land.

loans.use: To buy buy more soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum C., 50, and her husband, Mr. Phoeuk Chhum, 52, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1979 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and now live outside the family home, and the other two children study in Art College in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum has been selling grocery items for many years, purchasing them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of her house. She also buys mangoes on contract from her villagers for resale. Her husband is a farmer growing bananas, bitter gourds, and ridge gourds on his farm near the house. Sarum is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase mangoes from villagers for resale in the market and more grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for resale in the market and more grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia G. is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a girl who are both in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a trader. Cecilia also trades. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Cecilia also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells smoked fish and ice fish. She has been in this business for a long time. Florence hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. Florence is a 55 years old widow with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a business woman and has ten years' experience in sales. She sells Dumas clothes, linen, and lace materials. She is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She has five children who are currently in school. She helps support her family through her sales business. She is very hard-working and time-conscious but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds.

Victoria hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make more viable profit. She wants to purchase bulk quantities of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantities of Dumas clothes, etc. to increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Mgodi North in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,She is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 20,18 years.

Maria started her own business selling pigs 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 1200,00 Tanzania shillings.

This is Maria first loan from BRAC_Tanzania ,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh i order to buy more pigs for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Maria hopes to save more money and expand he business.

loans.use: To buy more for sale

loans.name: Grand Bassin Rayon D Espoir Group

texts.en:
The “Rayon D’espoir” or Ray of Hope group is made of twenty male and female entrepreneurs.  The group not only represents a variety in both ages of the representatives but also the types of businesses they have. The youngest of the group is under twenty years old and the eldest of the group is above sixty years old. The business range from furniture and door making, to sales of used clothing and sandals, and to a restaurant with international clientele that is on the boarder of the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Gamy J. P. is a representative of the group and also the youngest associate at 19yrs old.
Gamy, who has worked on construction and specialized in door making for some year, will use this loan  to buy wood, tools and sheet metal to create a place of business for himself. He is very enthusiastic about starting out a business of his own and realizes it will require hard work and patience to be successful. He looks forward to being able to help his family, parents and siblings,  and prepare a future for himself. On behalf of Gamy, Rayon D’espoir, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: wood, tools and sheet metal

loans.name: Nematillo

texts.en:
U. Nematillo has raised cattle and farmed for 19 years. With two children and the responsibility of providing food for his home has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today Nematillo finds himself in need of purchasing calves to raise in order to be able to take greatest advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason Nematillo is obtaining loan from IMON International in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Bayardo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Enrique Velásquez R. , tiene la edad de 66 años , habita en el barrio La conchitas , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante y apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen ocho hijos ; ya todos casados e independientes , don Bayardo desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le dieron tierras para que se apoyara y las trabajará para que saliera hacia delante con sus hijos , los principales problemas que le han afectado son las plagas , ya que este es el resultado de baja aplicación de fertilizantes e insumos que requiere el cultivo para poder estar en un buen estado. Agradece a la institución por la mano amiga que le hemos brindado ya que gracias a la asistencia técnica y  la buena aprobación de su crédito  el cual comprara fertilizantes y mejorara su producción, espera  tener mejores resultado y una buena cosecha para vender en un mejor precio y poder pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Bayardo Enrique Velásquez R. is 66 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of La Conchitas, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who works as a shopkeeper and helps him with home expenses. They have eight children, all of whom are married and independent. Since he was 30 years old, Bayardo has worked in agriculture after his parents gave him land to support himself, and he worked the land so that he could get his children ahead in life. The main problems that have affected his land have been plagues, which have resulted from not having used enough fertilizers and supplies that his crop requires to stay in good condition. Bayardo gives thanks to Kiva's partner institution for the friendly hand they have offered him, their technical assistance and for the approval of his loan which he will use to buy fertilizers and improve his production. He hopes to have better results and a good harvest to sell his crops at a better price and repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and improve production

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor H. R. S. is 40 years old and married with a 16-month-old daughter. He has a small farm that he tends and he also works on a neighboring coffee farm. He has some available pasture and so would like to use it for cows. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and will be his first experience raising his own cattle. He dreams that his daughter might go to college one day and would like to improve his farm to facilitate that. He has never had loans with other banks, as they were prohibitively expensive.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.en: Senora Rosa Emilia is 31 years old. She is married and has a 14-year-old in high school. An enterprising businesswoman, Rosa Emilia sells clothes during the day and at night she sells meals from a food stand. For the past two years, Rosa has managed these businesses. Her food stand is located in the central park in the city of Somotillo. She is well known for her banana chips, tacos and enchiladas. Her clothing she sells on foot. She hopes to be able to afford a cart to transport and better display her items. This loan of C$ 7,000 will go towards the purchase of supplies for her food cart and items to increase her inventory of clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and more supplies for her food cart

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza L. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old. Analiza is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living, Analiza sells seafood products including fish and shrimp to the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Analiza joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to purchase additional fish to sell. Analiza is requesting her second loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding her business.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bouraïma

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  habite dans le quartier de cassanblanca au centre de la ville de Lomé, il est marié et père d’un enfant. L’activité qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de ruminants et de volailles. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et il réalise d’excellents chiffres d’affaire surtout en périodes de fêtes. La fête de fin d’année étant proche, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 25 ruminants et 42 volailles.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Cassanblanca district at the center of the city of  Lomé.  He is married and the father of one.  The work he does that enables him to provide for his family is the commerce of ruminants and poultry.  This business is going well for him, and he is realizing excellent sales figures, especially during holidays.  With the approach of the New Year celebrations, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 ruminants and 42 birds.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ruminants and poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
keji R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell. keji is 40 years old and is married to a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Assane TIANE est une femme de 48 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 3 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA et y a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Elle fait la vente de petit déjeuner, de crème et de jus de fruits naturels. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assane Tiane is a woman of 48. She is married and has four children. For three years, she has been a mamber of the Banc Villageois of Gadapara and has profited from six loans there, which she has repaid regularly. She sells breakfast, cream, and natural fruit juices. She contributes to the betterment of her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: ce jeune homme vendeur de produit cosmétique est membre à la caisse de liberté 6 depuis 2007 il habite juste a coté de la caisse il achète des produits comme les parfum le lait de toilette actuellement a son troisième prêt il sollicite un montant de 500 000 F CFA pour acheter des produits cosmétique et augmenter son fond de roulement
texts.en:
Lamine C. is a young man who sells cosmetics. He has been a member of the village bank "Liberté 6" (Freedom 6) since 2007 and lives right next to it. He trades in cosmetics, such as perfume and body milk. This is his third loan. It amounts to 500,000 CFA francs and he will use it to buy cosmetics and increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetics

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel G. is from the town of Rosary Ville, Sto. Rosario Capas, Tarlac. He is 43 years old. Ariel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ariel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing and slippers services to local community members. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ariel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ariel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

location.town: Rosary Ville, Sto. Rosario Capas, Tarlac

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work materials

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Martínez se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por preocuparse por el bienestar de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha requerido la inversión para reconstruirla. Ella actualmente está solicitndo un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra y así beneficiar directamente a toda su familia con un techo digno donde habitar.

Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque saldrá adelante con dicho crédito y mejorará sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Elsa Martínez Meléndez works as a file clerk in the Oriental market in Managua. She has one child in her care, who is school-aged. She is married, and has taken 5 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 9 years. Over this time she has invested the loans in improvements to her house. She was able to do this thanks to the financings provided by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to buy construction materials such as: sand, cement and steel to reinforce the walls of her house. She wants to do this to provide better security and a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
María Luz tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito ubicado a dos horas de Chiclayo y que se caracteriza por tener un territorio bastante accidentado debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país (limita con la región Cajamarca), su principal actividad es la agricultura.

Lleva mas de 10 años vendiendo cerveza en un pequeño bar ubicado en su vivienda, el negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares, por este motivo ella da lo mejor de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

El negocio es bastante conocido en la zona y ha ido creciendo poco a poco, María Luz desea ampliarlo con la compra de más bebidas de modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevo soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Luz es una mujer alegre y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Luz, 40, lives with her family in Oyotun, about two hours from Chiclayo, in a hilly region at the foot of the mountains of northern Peru (and near the border with the Cajamarca region). Her main source of income is farming. For more than 10 years, she has sold beer in a small bar that she runs from her house. The business is an important source of revenue for the family because Maria Luz's husband's income as a farmer isn't enough to cover the family's expenses. For that reason, she gives her all to advancing the business. The business has become well-known in the area after growing little by little. Maria Luz wants to expand further by adding products that her customers want and, consequently, she's applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new soles loan to help her meet that demand. Maria Luz is a happy woman, devoted to her family, and her greatest wish is to provide them with a better quality of life. She is well-known and respected in the neighborhood and her neighbors consider her to be someone they can trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for bar business.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Victoriosas son cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Joseling M. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa el cual inicio por medio de un préstamo. Ella invertirá en mercadería para surtir su negocio el cual algún día se convertirá en una gran tienda. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Concepción H. quien desde hace diecisiete años es comerciante de gaseosa y ropa usada,  Guadalupe H. vende  reposterías y refrescos y Ana del Socorro López Álvarez quien tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The group Victorious Women is comprised of four hard-working and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Joseling M., who dedicates herself to selling clothing, a business she started with the help of a loan. She will invest in merchandise to supply her business, which she hopes to eventually convert into a large store. The other members of the group are Concepción H. who has sold sodas and used clothing for the past seventeen years, Guadalupe H. who sells pastries and refreshments, and Ana del Socorro López Álvarez who has a small clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is faithful and industrious businesswoman who sells groceries to customers. She is married to a petty trader. She is 27 years old and mother of one child who is 4 years old. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and supporting her family. She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. She sells groceries like candies, mineral water, toiletries, hair creams, assorted biscuits, etc. She has operated her shop for the past 2 years in her neighborhood. 

Stella believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draw customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful grocers. She plans to use the loan to purchase more groceries to serve her customers. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits so that she will be able to rent a bigger store and do wholesale grocery sales.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Argentina Jotassone

texts.pt:
Argentina Jotassone Mariquele nasceu na cidade de Xai xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 21 e 20 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Frequenta 6ą classe no curso nocturno porque na altura não teve oportunidade de continuar devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Xai xai para Maputo sozinha com objectivo de vir residir com a irmã. Mais tarde casou se e fixou sua residência em Boane. Tem um negócio próprio que desenvolve ha mais de 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.900.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento cola, tijoleiras e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra de construção da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um aviário e iniciar actividade de venda de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Argentina Jotassone M. was born in the city of Xai-xai, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 37 years old, married and has two children who are 21 and 20 years old. The younger child goes to school. Argentina is attending 6th grade night school classes because she became pregnant while very young and was unable to finish school. She lives in her own house with her family and supports a nephew who lives with her. She left Xai-xai by herself to move to Maputo so she could live with her sister. Later she married and made her home in Boane. Argentina has had her own business for more than two years. She has no employees and has an income of about 7,900 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account at Millenium Bim. She has never had loans from other banks. Argentina learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is her first loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais. She intends to buy construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks and other items) to continue construction on her house. Argentina promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. In the future she intends to apply for loans to build a chicken coop and start selling broiler chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Asonta

texts.es: Asonta, D. 54 años, es una madre D. familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Feliciano D. 80 años y el menor D. sus hijos Francisco D. 25 años, quien le ayuda en el cuidado D. su chacra. Con mucho esfuerzo Asonta ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, plátano, maíz y café, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en la ciudad D. Pichanaki. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse firme en su economía, es por eso que pone todo su esfuerzo en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo espera comprarse nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Asonta is 54 years old. She is the mother of a very loving and hardworking family. She lives in her own house with 80-year-old husband Feliciano. The youngest of her sons is 25-year-old Francisco, who helps her look after their small farm. Through much hard work, Asonta has managed to work her land and make them productive. She grows bananas, corn and coffee, which she then sells wholesale in the town of Pichanaki. Through considerable effort and with the income she receives from the sale of her crops, she is able to keep her business going. She loves looking after her own crops and has been working in this way for 20 years. Carrying her products to Pichanaki is the most difficult task she faces, since the sacks are very heavy and she gets very tired. In time, she would like to buy more land, to increase the amount of crops she produces. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she has always been very punctual in making her payments. She expects to be this time also. Asonta is a very active member of her communal group and always keeps herself informed of the agreements that the group has reached. With the 1000 soles that she has requested, Asonta will buy more fertilisers and insecticides, so as to improve her crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva M. is a 67-year-old widow who supports her family by owning and operating a general store. She lives in Prk. Bolinao, Manapla, Negros Occidental with her six children who are between 28 and 40 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 2,000.

Minerva is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Minerva aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Ma P., 36, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for being the favorite tourist place in the country.

P. and her husband are farmers and recyclers, earning an income of USD 5 each per day. P.'s husband appears in the photograph because P. was not available.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizer to improve their farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve their farm

loans.name: Aracelie's Group

texts.en:
Aracelie B. is from the town of Burgos Cabarroguis, Quirino. She is 58 years-old and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Aracelie B..

Aracelie is separated from her spouse and has eight adult children. To make a living, Aracelie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aracelie has been engaged in her business for over sux years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Aracelie joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aracelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aracelie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aracelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
