ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is married to S. and belongs to a small city near to Lahore Pakistan called Kot radha kishen. She owns a three room brick house where she lives with her husband and five children. Four of them are daughters and one is a son. 

Her eldest daughter works in a factory. Her all other children stay at home. Riffat and her husband couldn’t educate their children due to poor financial conditions.  

Her husband works as a laborer. It is very difficult to survive as a laborer because it’s not a permanent job: many times her husband doesn’t get work regularly. Riffat wants her husband to start his own grocery shop so he makes a regular income. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah. With the loan amount her husband will buy groceries in bulk and start a grocery shop in the nearby market.  

Riffat is hopeful that her husband will be able to establish his business very soon and start earning a regular income. 

She wants to marry her eldest daughter who is now of 24 years old. She hopes that with the increased income she will be able to do this soon. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan cycle. She has proved herself as a very responsible client and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: starting a grocery store

loans.name: Ireen Joy

texts.en: Ireen Joy B. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Ireen Joy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Ireen Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Riski

texts.en:
Riski is a divorced mother who, since she took sole responsibility for raising her young children, has labored tirelessly to provide for all their needs. It was because of her strong work ethic that she found stable employment 10 years ago in cattle and sheep breeding. Things have slowly improved, but she would like to make further progress. Riski is requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni to improve the installations used to raise animals and provide an environment where she can increase their numbers and improve their living conditions. Let's help make Riski's hard work pay off so that her family can enjoy a better quality of life! 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine S. was born in1940, she is married to James, and they are blessed with three children and live in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Geraldine S. has faced some challenges in life. She has been strungling with ill health and the problem of poor yield due to natural disaster. The most difficult has been the problem of raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education, and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, for the production of cash crops and other farm produce such as cassava, corn, and cocoayams. Most especially cassava, which is used in the production of garri and water-fufu. She also plans to invest part in her general provision store, which will raise the daily income for her family. She believes the business will succeed because she was born a farmer and now she is an expert in farming. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Geraldine S. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy beans and cassava seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine A. N. is a married lady with one child aged 3 years. Her business is located at Manyatta, a busy market in Kisumu. Kisumu is in Nyanza province and borders western Kenya. The region is well-known for production of tilapia and omena fish from Lake Victoria.  

She sells such food items as omena fish gotten from Lake Victoria. Other times, she makes doughnuts, which she sells to the local people. She has been in this kind of business for three years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of enough funds. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cooking oil and baking flour to expand her business. She hopes to have a mini-bakery in the future. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Cooking oil and baking flour

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Ёрматов Манучехр проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 24 года. Холост. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Он привозит миндаль и фисташки с района и продает на рынке города оптом.  Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Манучехр хочет получить больше прибыли, так как он намерен устроить свою свадьбу и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Manuchehr Y. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 24 years old, not married. He has secondary education. He has been in sales for more than five years. He produces almonds and pistachios and sells wholesale on the market. He is taking out the loan to increase sales. Manuchehr wants to get more profit as he plans to celebrate his wedding and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Chinarkul

texts.en:
Chinarkul S. is a 53-year-old married farmer with three grown children. She started her business breeding livestock almost twenty years ago, which became the only means of subsistence for her family.  With the initial capital of 7,000 Kyrgyz Soms, she managed to raise her floating capital and, at present, she earns about 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms each month.  

To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastures her livestock in mountainous areas with native grasses.  In order to increase the number of cattle, Chinarkul obtained two loans from Bai-Tushum and Partners and repaid them without any delays. Now Chinarkul is applying for a loan of 64,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy bull calves. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase bull calves

loans.name: Judith Genoveva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Judith Genoveva; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de realizar eventos como matrimonios, bautizos y quince años, la socia organiza diferentes eventos y ahora tiene un pollería, la socia trabaja en forma independiente, es una mujer que siempre está trabajando para sacar adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere mejorar la pollería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un horno para la pollería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
udith Genoveva is a member of the “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Judith is 36 years old.  She is divorced and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business organizing events such as weddings, baptisms and 15th birthday celebrations.  She organizes different events and now also has a poultry store.  She is self-employed and is always working to get her child ahead in life.  She would like to improve her poultry store.  She is requesting a loan to buy an oven for the store.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy an oven for her poultry store

loans.name: Hubert

texts.en:
Hubert is thirty-five years old.  He lives with his partner and their three children in the small community of Saltur in the Zaña district.  It is a rural region approximately forty minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.  It occupies a river valley, and through complicated irrigation systems and a relatively high water table, the population is able to plant a wide variety of crops, including rice, corn and sugar cane.

Hubert sells bread and other baked goods, including empanadas, cookies and sweets.  He has sold these items for over five years and has a good number of loyal clients who frequently pass by his regular sales spots.  He is proud to play an integral role in the daily nutrition and enjoyment of his neighbors.

This will be Hubert’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the loan funds to increase his daily inventory and take advantage of the growing demands of his clientele.  He also hopes that this will enable him to make larger purchases each morning in order to obtain greater bulk discounts.  Hubert is a hard working man, with a strong drive to get ahead in life.  He hopes to be able to increase his family’s opportunities and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: To increase his daily inventory and take advantage of the growing demands of his clientele.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She opened her store four years ago.

Susana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering
